LQCC - the-drive
LQCC
🌾 TO GUIDE OR BE GUIDED / the-drive
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 01:00 AM
[ AFTERNOON ] It's another warm afternoon in Meteor City. Autumn is passing by quickly, and soon the days will turn colder, shorter, and darker. Though none of that is an issue for now. The detectives are all waiting outside the building, bundled up in whatever clothes they chose to wear, bringing whatever items they usually carried on their person. There was nothing in particular one could prepare for when one wasn't told anything at all. All they knew was the following: Luka was on her way back, and this job needed more people on it. As for the details... well that's what was supposed to come soon enough. The birds chirp, the sun shines, and down the street an unfamiliar car makes its way to the building. A van, large enough to fit the 9, soon to be 10, of you comfortably enough, was making itself known to you as your vehicle of choice as it slowly rolled to a stop in front of the building. Long drive, they said. Unfortunately for some of you, it looks like you'll have to be in close company for a while. The driver parks the car (safety first), and the door slowly swings open, revealing a familiar figure seated inside. Pale blonde hair with dark roots, tired eyes with bags underneath, and a wry smile etched onto her face. She shuffles the documents on her lap, moving herself to the side to make room for her companions. "Long time no see, hop in. We've got a long drive to go." @guided
01:00
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wTrBCSLu2FY
markcato - Topic
Sumeru Tavern Theme
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 01:08 AM
After a moment's hesitation, she slides into the seat nearest to her, which happens to be relatively close to Luka. But she keeps her distance, for the other's sake, as well as her own. Legs crossing, she sits in a way that takes up as little space as possible, while also leaving room for her to shift without bumping into anyone. A tight squeeze for sure, she notes mentally with a subtle twinge of the lips. "Long time," she echoes with a nod, taking note of the bags under her eyes. Of the items she'd thought to bring was a tumbler, filled with tea. Wordlessly, she holds it up, a silent offer for the weary detective. And to anyone else, too— if they didn't mind drinking from the same cup. @dodo | luka
Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 01:10 AM
Malachy suppose it'll be too suspicious if he didn't take any cases at all, it's nothing short of a miracle that he's even still on the payroll. With no information and no preparations to be made, he decided not to worry much about it. No point in agonizing over something that he has no control in, right? :picknose: Mint casually plopped himself down next to Luka's other side, obviously peeking into the documents that she was holding. "Hey, whose car is this? The client's?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 01:15 AM
She leans forward and accepts the cup of tea, careful not to burn her tongue as she took a sip. She nods towards Eunji, a silent thank you in her direction as she turns to answer the questions at hand. "No-- a rental." She shakes her head. The client... Right. The client. "We actually.... don't know who the client is." She sighs, shuffling the documents so Mint could take a better look. To tell the truth, he probably wouldn't be able to understand anything on there yet. Some photos, some notes, a bunch of newspaper clippings and other scattered pieces of paper. She takes a glance around the car, making sure everyone is packed in tight before signaling to the driver they were ready to be on their way. "You all probably know already, but LQCC's always getting these mysterious notes. This time we got one that was... really vague." She pauses before shuffling through the documents on her lap. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 04-Nov-22 01:27 AM
Ashley wondered a moment after surveying the other detectives around him, all of which were his seniors. Sure, that might not be difficult considering how new he was, but that was the other thing wasn't it? He was new and this was his second mission. All hands on deck and all, but he wondered how helpful he could be for this one. Still, all he could do was try to earn his keep for now, so he shuffled in with the rest, listening intently as information was slowly drizzled onto their table. "Was was the request this time?" @dodo | luka
Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 01:28 AM
His bigger question is why do LQCC keep taking these shady ass clients?! Considering the rental, though, he's under the assumption these mysterious clients are pretty loaded. They need to keep the lights on, I guess. "Did it say on the note?" @dodo | luka
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 01:30 AM
Her brows furrow, lips parting around a question— but Ashley (an unfamiliar face, she thinks) is faster, and she poses another question. "Were any of the notes handwritten..? Perhaps it could be someone within our circles. Not a stranger." @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 01:32 AM
"Well..." She trails off as she continues shuffling through her documents. Finding the right piece of paper, she pulls it out before holding it up for everyone to see. A typewritten letter:
Please, Save them.
She sighs. Anomalous events were anomalous events. Someone had to go out and investigate. "There was a location listed on here too, a small place in Washington... which is where we're headed right now by the way." She shakes her head with a shrug. "In any case. Boss sent me out to take a look at the area-- see if anything was going on, and I didn't see anything strange right away... but I did some more digging and found that there's been a slow string of missing people." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 04-Nov-22 01:43 AM
Wow she wasn't kidding about vague "And these missing people might be related too, is what you've concluded?" He wonders a moment, to have typed a note, print and sent it that way instead of a hastily written one might imply that, though urgent, there's enough time for the sender to do that much. He wonders what such a vague plea for help could do though, so little hints that could really help these detective deduce the location of these victims faster. Though he hoped it was a true enough cry for help, rather than a strange messed up prank. "You say the client is unknown? Was this letter found in.. the agency's mail then? No return address and all?" He takes a look at the letter, it's just any old letter right? Is the quality of paper just.. normal? New, paper? Nothing that might imply age? Same goes with ink. It isn't faded? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 01:50 AM
"Well... I don't know if it's related to this note directly, but with so many people gone missing, there has to be some kind of connection." It was a long stretch, but it was one of the few leads she got after her investigation. "Return address leads back to the location written on the sheet, but there's no house associated with it." That was the odd part to her. "The general location fits, the specific one doesn't. I have a feeling they probably either don't want to... or can't be found out." As for the quality of the paper: It's standard 20lb copy. Relatively worn down, but Luka makes note that prior to her folding and unfolding of the letter, it seemed new enough to show that the letter was recent. @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 04-Nov-22 01:53 AM
Interesting. "Have you started on investigating these disappearances by any chance? Or were you just about to" @dodo | luka
Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 01:53 AM
"'Huh." He was quiet for a second before piping up again. "Good thing you called for backup, then! Doesn't sound like something you should investigate alone." What do they have to hide? He wonders how involved the client actually is, maybe they also don't want to get too tied up into it... "Is there like, any sort of pattern to the people who disappeared?" @dodo | luka
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 01:54 AM
Pardon. But her face does pale a bit upon realizing their intended destination. "Washington?" she mutters, disbelieving. Her gaze drags across the other detectives sitting in the car with them, and chokes back a wheezing bit of laughter. Ah. Ah...... How many days would this be? Two? Three? The tension in her shoulders does not ease with each passing thought. "Did you look into any footage focused on the location? Or around it? Any people passing by that caught your attention?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 01:58 AM
She nods before shuffling through her folder once more. "Good you brought it up. The latest two people who were missing went by the names Mara Roderic and Emil Henry. Roderic was a journalist for a small newspaper, looking into the disappearances for..." Luka waves her hand in the air, forming quotes around her words. "--a hit article on the romantic disappearances along the coast." "Henry, was a student who went on vacation. A bit of a loner, not many friends from what I gathered. The only thing they had in common was that they were both in the village." @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint (edited)
02:04
She sighs at Eunji's question, brows knitting themselves together with a frown. "The thing is...." What was the most polite way to say this.... was there even one. "It's a backwater village... type... thing." They have no CCTV. At all. "There's a couple of people you should look out for actually... They don't take too kindly to investigators, so don't tell them you're detectives." Another sigh. "That's what put a stop to most of my leads actually. Pull out the badge and people think you've got authority and refuse to speak." "But back onto topic. We're headed to a small coastal village, just to be clear. The village chief seems to be the main authority in town... I didn't manage to grab his name, but you'll know it's him if you see him... He likes to introduce himself as such." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
02:06

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 02:14 AM
"I see," she nods, pulling out her own notebook to jot down the details. "And... does this village get many visitors? Were they both locals? It seems that Mara had a very romanticized view of things..." Eunji peers closely at the photo. "Do you know if she was friendly with anyone?" It felt a bit odd to be questioning Luka of all people, but with no one else to ask, they truly were left with no other option.... @dodo | luka
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 04-Nov-22 02:14 AM
"I see" he nods, it makes sense he thinks, for smaller areas to be wary of other people in power from bigger cities. Investigators coming into your village is a sure sign that something might be wrong, and they might be less inclined to agree to such a statement, even if it wasn't spoken. "And these missing people, they were also people that belong to this villages? Or random people outside of the village going missing while they're in the area? Or a mix of both?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 02:20 AM
"Not locals to the village itself. They were from the greater general area. I'm not too sure about her relationships within the village... but apparently people generally had a good impression about her, even though she was a little loud." "So far, from what I've tracked down, everyone who's gone missing wasn't from the village itself. There are a couple of other disappearance cases that I think might be linked-- the missing people weren't headed to the village directly... but their destination passed through it." She holds up another document. A string of dates, a list of names, and a row of destinations. She's done a lot of research, a weak link as it is. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 02:28 AM
She taps her hands against the folder. "I thought the same for a while... but I heard that the village is also a popular port which makes it easy for people to escape if they're on the run." She shook her head. "The last two photos I showed you have two individuals that I don't think have any motive to run away... but it's hard to tell how many people actually went missing as a result of the village... or if that's even the case in the first place." To put it simply: don't jump to a conclusion too quickly. "It might be worth looking into, but if other investigators haven't found anything... well... in that case, be careful. Not everyone who's been there disappears after all." Case in point. Luka made it back. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint

dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 03:02 AM
"Simple notes, I ran the papers through a couple of quick field tests, courtesy of some knowlesge from our coworkers... but revealed nothing. This note is the only one we received... Everything else I've told you all is a result of my own investigation." "The local police haven't managed to find anything about the disappearances, because most of them have reason to want to run away... debt, failed relationships, things like that... so it's hard to conclude whether or not it's a result of anomalous behavior, since most cases seem to link to other reasons." She shakes her head at the mention. "I can't help but think the note is too much of a coincidence... but it could still be that. Just a coincidence." "And uh... I mean if you like it then you like it..." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 03:14 AM
[ A SUMMARY OF EVENTS SO FAR ] - Luka is back from an investigation in a [ coastal village ] in Washington. - The "client" is a typewritten note that reads [ Please, Save them. ]. The note itself is normal, is recent, has no anomalous properties, and no secret message. - Luka's personal investigation has found that there have been a string of [ missing people ] in the area. The two most recent disappearances are: [ MARA RODERIC ] and [ EMIL HENRY ]. - Not everyone who passes by the area disappears, and many people who are marked missing have good reason to run away, debts, interpersonal issues, etc. The small port makes a good getaway spot so police have not linked the disappearances to the village specifically. - Locals have not gone missing. - Luka recommends investigating the area and finding out who "them" refers to. She also notes that the people don't take kindly to authority, so [ you should all be there in disguise, ie. Do Not announce you are detectives. ] - Feel free to make a purchase at the state gift shop if you wish to make a tourist getup. IF YOU HAVE ANYTHING YOU WOULD LIKE TO ASK, FEEL FREE TO PING ME ANYTIME BEFORE THE MISSION BEGINS!
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 04:03 PM
Luka shuffles in her seat, craning her neck out the window now that they were nearing their destination. "Be sure to be wary of any potential, dangerous situations... I won't be on the field with you because everyone there knows I'm a detective, but I'll be on the walkie talkie, so that I can answer any questions you might have that we didn't cover before." YOU HAVE UNLOCKED: LUKA ON THE WALKIE TALKIE. "And one more thing..." She reaches under her seat to pull out a trunk. "Um.... don't ask where I got these (from Jacob, but don't ask it where it got them from)." And opens it to reveal several weapons: guns and knives. For personal safety. You know. IF YOU HAVE NOT ALREADY, PLEASE LIST: YOUR WASHINGTON GIFT STORE HAUL + WEAPON OF CHOICE (ONE GUN OR ONE KNIFE). IF YOUR CHARACTER IS ALREADY EQUIPPED WITH A WEAPON... YOU CAN STILL PICK FROM THE TRUNK. YIPPEE. @guided (edited)

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 04:13 PM
‍♂️ By the grace of God, someone has managed to cajole him into putting on an "I ❤️ Washington" t-shirt. There's a mini-Washington keychain dangling from his ️i-phone (the newest model, to be clear), and a deck of Washington-themed playing cards tucked into the back pocket of his khakis. Reluctantly, he looks over the weapons. He reaches for a knife, before taking a surreptitious glance at his colleagues— —his hand lands on the stock of a handgun instead. He tucks it away with a frown. He can't name a single city in Washington state, nor can he come up with a good reason why anyone would decide to vacation here, but with the camera hanging from his neck and the (decidedly not Washington-shaped) sunglasses sliding down his nose, Adrian does look the part of a classic tourist. For better or for worse.
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 04:14 PM
The blond was quiet for the most part of the trip, staring out the window with a gloved hand breezing over his patched eye every now and then. Nearly completely healed, but not quite yet. As they neared the gift shop and were required to select disguises, Seven didn't really think he needed to change much of his look given that he was actually a tourist in America... So he opts to grab what every tourist needs. A disposable camera & A map He shoves the items in his jacket pockets before returning to Luka who was presenting the trunk of weapons. Brows raise in surprise as he pulls up his hat to get a better look. This was a selection indeed. A knife was already settled on his thigh belt hidden under his jacket so that blond gingerly takes a gun, ensuring the safety is on before tucking it away in the band of his pants. He had hoped he wouldn't have to use it to begin with. His aim has been a little shakey given his new sight...

ASHLEY WALKER BOT 04-Nov-22 04:27 PM
Ashley was nodding at everything Luka was saying, noting everything down, the potential dangers of these missions. He seemed to understand. Until the trunk full of weapon was revealed. For reasons unknown to him he froze, or well. It would have been normal to be nervous at the sight of very real weapons, but there was an immediate realization now, a looming sense of dread that this mission may very well go much different than his last one. He remembered Olwen's words and how her first mission went, and he could feel himself swallow a lump on his throat. And yet his hand reaches for the gun, and held it in his hands. It felt... strangely natural. He tested it out, pulling the safety off and loaded it with bullets. The clink and movement felt even more strangely natural. The lump on his throat grew,. But he put the safety back on and hid the gun in his person. Opting to not think about it that much. "Thank you detective." He smiles, this time it hid more than just performance anxiety.
1
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 04:33 PM
As Quincy becomes all dressed up in her fancy tourist clothes, Seven absently brings up the camera to her. "Hey Carter." Seven calls, coaxing the redhead to look to him and taking a surprise shot. The disposable camera flashes brightly, blinding near everyone in the vicinity. @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf
3
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 04:33 PM
Now that most of you are... relatively well equipped. <3. If you turn your head outside, you can catch the sight of the coast after your long drive. The mountains aren't too steep, the road makes a couple twists and turns before evening out to a rather open view facing the ocean off a cliff. It would be quite breathtaking indeed if you were all tourists like you were playing as. The van starts to slow down as you get closer to your destination, driving a leisurely pace as you pass through the sights. Far off to the side you see a small path of steps, and a figure dressed... in some kind of ceremonial clothing standing in front of a small roadside shrine. To some of you, the clothing is of a familiar style, to others, it's something completely out of the blue. @guided (edited)
16:33
But in any case... you continue on. The van finally slows to a stop in front of the entrance to what seems to be a small village, one that housed no more than a hundred people. Taking a step out, you could smell the salty spray of the ocean mixed with the crisp air of the mountains. An odd mix but refreshing nonetheless. "Remember detectives. I'll be on call from the van. Reach out if you have any questions." "Don't go off alone, be sure to be wary of everyone you see and don't blow your cover" #village #cliffside #shrine #ceremonial-site

Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 04-Nov-22 04:42 PM
Quincy is completely caught off guard and Seven manages to snap a picture of her, mid-blinking with a dumb look on her face!! gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg 06-Nov-22 01:55 PM

TIMELINE? IDK
gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg 06-Nov-22 02:04 PM
THIS IS ALL THEORY Choi Subin “Bin” → Sister Shaman at the ceremony site. The sister never left; can be seen in their dialogue and opinion about people leaving the village. "Beats me. I never left." and "There's a hint of bitterness in their voice, though the source of the emotion is unknown." Choi Sumin “Min” → Brother Shaman at the shrine. Min is probably the "aloof" black-haired person that Danny mentioned, and I think it suits the shaman's personality. There also seems to be travel tickets hidden away in the shrine, implying that this person (or perhaps their family) traveled a lot. It sounds like the brother left, according to the chief's journal and according to Adrian's solo. When KSH, MCG, and Ashley left the shrine, Hyacinth sounded surprised that a shaman with a middle part was in there, so he likely came back somewhat recently? ----- Something of note,,, Bin says this at the ceremonial site: Sorry I really am a god with no power. And in the flashbacks, it sounds like Bin is supposed to inherit the shrine duties, not Min. (Mother to daughter, not to both of them - mentioned in Eunji's solo). But in Adrian's solo, it sounds like they're talking about both inheriting it again.

Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 04:41 PM
Aw, he doesn't want to stray off too much from the main path...let's leave that to the more experienced and dedicated detectives. Dressed in his usual outfit and having faith in his pre-existing Tourist Vibes, he started walking towards the village.
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 04:49 PM
[THE VILLAGE] It's straightforward, at least. The town slopes gently upwards to what you presume is the hubbub of their communal spaces, but the homes line the roads, built brick upon brick of terracotta and stone. The roofs of the home are green, color pale in the autumn, slanted ceramic that protect them from the slight wind chill that blows through the town. It's homey, at least. There's a few people lingering here and there — kids running across the street chasing each other with toys, or old men chatting at the opening of houses, keeping watch as they side-eye the strangers.
OST: Welcome Home https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y_1syKDZ9qs&ab_channel=Oohyo-Topic

[DEC 0030] The breeze flows from the ocean, a signal that I thought would be one of good fortune. Not everything is as well as I want it to be. Earlier today YH told me that she received an ominous message from the spirits. Ill-met fate she mentioned. She said she needed to leave the village to avoid destiny… but what kind of nonsense is that? A shaman leaving her village? There has to be another solution. [JAN 0031] There are so many alternatives but she doesn’t like any of them. Her vision isn’t about *her* but about her *children*. Separate them, or send them away. It doesn’t matter. As long as I get to keep the village safe. We still have to figure out what to do with *that* by the cliffside. [FEB 0040] I hesitate to write this down, but I feel as if it should be documented with the rest of the events that have occurred. Ever since ḫ̷͑ê̴͛ left, ì̸͓n̸̢͠s̸̐̆c̵̉̔ṙ̶͠i̴͓̎p̵̯̌t̴̀͝ĩ̴̤ö̴̻́ṉ̷̓s̷̊̆ have been appearing on the villagers. Is it a result of his disappearance? Is it a curse from t̷̝͂ḣ̷̟e̴͌͝ ̶̊͘r̴̔͋ȋ̵̌v̵̈́̒e̸͌͛r̶̅̍ ̴̋̄ǵ̵̕o̸͔̚d̶̀͘? I fear it’s already spread to all the villagers. [MAY 0040] 05/05. First casualty.
GRAPHIC DESCRIPTIONS OF PARASITISM AND EYE GORE FOLLOW.
You rub with your sleeve, but it's like something's burrowed within it, trying to get out. It scratches its spindly legs against your iris, and your vision blurs briefly as you try to put on pressure to relieve yourself of the pain, whatever you can do as a salve. When you pull your sleeve away its dotted with red. Your eye throbs with self-inflicted pain. It's a little sore — you didn't break it or anything, and you doubt blood can be drawn by scratching too hard, but you feel something wet and thick leak out of your eyeduct anyway, carve down your face. Anyways, there's no other choice but to keep reading. [DEC 0040] I have no choice. The village is mine to ~~r̶̛͓u̸̔͐l̵͐̈́ę̵̊ ̸̛̗o̴͊̓v̵̽͐e̶̎̉r̵͒̓~~ protect. [MAR 0050] It was easier when it was just the vagabonds who came here for lack of anywhere else to go. We need more people with each passing month. You flip through a few more pages and it's just row and row of the same sigil that Tima had drawn on the very first page, but this is the first time both of you had seen it. Weird... ? @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint @scarecROY 💜👻 tima

Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 09:21 PM

He never saw this much blood, much less coming from him. He's lightheaded, about ready to faint had it not for the voice coming from behind them that jolted him back to reality. He almost snapped at the old man for stating the obvious but as he peeked at the village chief through the cloth, there's clearly bigger problems for them right now. He's way too calm, eerily calm, and his mind immediately goes to the gun in his bag. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums @scarecROY 💜👻 tima
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 09:26 PM
"Sure, but not this room." His voice is pleasant and light, but carries a hint of authority you might've heard others use. Joking and slack until the noose is tightened and you find yourself choking on the other end, lulled into a false sense of complacency by someone deciding to be nice to you. "I did find the gifts. I was hoping to share them with you in the living room, to be honest." His eyes narrow at the blood, but the hand behind his back doesn't budge. Eventually, after a long moment of tension, the man breaks out into a grin, stepping back as he makes sure to keep his front to you at all times. "Right this way. You can settle yourself in the living room. I'll take your injured companion to the kitchen." @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint @scarecROY 💜👻 tima
Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 09:34 PM
In the kitchen where the big knives are? He remembers Luka's advice about not splitting up, ringing in his ears in this dire moment of horror-like movie terror as he gritted his teeth. He braced himself before he took his face off the cloth, and gave them both his best smile. "I.........think the bleeding's already slowing down, don't worry! I'll be fine, I'll hate to trouble you with well, whatever this was." He laughed and gives them a thumbs up. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums @scarecROY 💜👻 tima

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 09:53 PM
"Hmm," he says, unconvinced, though he's willing to let it slide since you're good kids. "Your eye just bleeds sometimes. You should probably get a doctor to check on that." He brightens, a falsetto that matches Tima's own practised maneuvers. "Luckily we have a doctor in this village. Imagine if we didn't." "It'd be miles of miles of driving before you can get any help," he says pleasantly, pulling back. Whatever he hid behind him is now at his front as he turns around to lead you into the living room. You notice, perhaps belatedly, that all the paintings have turned into the same thing. A single tree, with paper talismans hanging over it, and a big, inked symbol over all the paintings and all the mirrors, all reflective surfaces. The same symbol you saw in the notebook. The same symbol you drew. And the same symbol that now covers your pupil with Mint blinks at you, or when Tima goes to inspect their palm, turned upright. Ever since the start, even before you stepped in here, your fate was sealed. All the seed needed was a little watering, a little love — and it would sprout and take you anew, bursting froth from wherever it could find its sunlight. You feel weak, as if you've lost a lot of blood. The flowers that bloomed brightly in the vase that greeted you as you entered are all dead and rotten, blackened corpses releasing a putrid, sweet-sticky scent of death of decay that's hard to forget.
LAST POSTS BEFORE THE END OF THE DAY. You character is steadily losing consciousness and will be unconscious soon.
@Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint @scarecROY 💜👻 tima
3
Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 04-Nov-22 10:11 PM
Tima holds her breath as the chief turns away, as the two of them follow the man through the halls. She sees the paintings, smells the rot, watches that repeated symbol crawling and bleeding its way through her flesh and bones- -and feels a strange sense of relief. Oh. This is just a nightmare. She thinks, as her body weakens. Knees collapse and she sways, eyes struggling to stay open. It's a thin veneer of normalcy painted over deep terror - but as soon as she accepts it, embraces the lie, there is no more fear. I'm waking up now. I'll be awake soon. She uses all her energy to glance towards Mint and lets out a soft, delirious laugh, staring at the symbol on his eye. It's a dream - it's just a dream- "...See you in the real world." She whispers. And then everything is dark.
4
Malachy Faragher BOT 04-Nov-22 10:18 PM
He suppose had their positions been reversed, he wouldn't have believed himself either. Not that it matters. Only so much you can do when the trap was laid out from the start. The symbol. The talisman, he wondered what it all meant...he tried to connect it with the information that he learned but before he managed to plot out any dots, he already dropped down on the floor. The real what..? Tima's laugh and words was the opposite of comforting. He hopes he'll wake up again.

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 04:57 PM
[THE CLIFFSIDE] It's not that far of a walk from the outskirts of the town. The sky is a particularly clear shade of blue-grey that stretches on to the horizon, with the dark rocks of the village continuing to your left. The slight breeze, as always, is stronger near the water, spurred on by nature's pull on each other. There's a rope tether preventing you from going any farther than a distance, warning for a fall and erosion, but it's not that much compared to your long legs. You can easily overstep it, if you wish. Nothing seems out of place, it looks like. Just the usual old... cliff. Ugh. Why did you even come here... ... Surprisingly, there's a figure that stands on the edge of an adjacent cliff, overlooking the water. She's trespassed the rope boundary to stand as close to the edge as possible without falling. You watch as she kneels to pick at flowers that grow alongside its edge, her pink hair catching the breeze as she hums, broken notes reaching the two of you, distorted by the wind's whistle.
OST: Expecting You https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4rly4u2MeO4&ab_channel=Markcato

"Charlotte." She lifts your intertwined hands to her lips, looking at you in the eyes as she presses her soft lips against your knuckles, one between each bone. She values you — every part of you, and wants to honor that through physical devotion. Her sleeve falls away from her arm slightly, and you glimpse some sort of dark tattoo against the inside of her arm. "And you? What's your name?" @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf The flame catches on the fabric and gives you blessed light, illuminating what's in the dark — — but you know, it's in the dark for a reason. You illuminate a narrow sphere around you, where the scratches continue from the wall beside you... to the ceiling above, the wall opposite, and even on the ground, as if something was trying to keep itself from being dragged deeper into the cave. ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 08:11 PM
The marks scratch at the inside of your mind. It's like trying to remember the name at the tip of your tongue, a word or a phrase, a familiar friend — then it all clicks when you step back. What you had originally assumed to be natural marbling of the wall turns out to be the same pattern, over and over, looped and intertwined in itself to form a wide-casting net. And you... are the fish. When your eyes close you can still see the pattern inscribed into your mind. You can't help but imagine it unfurling and untwining, a living being writhing... and when you open your eyes it's still there. No escape. Your nose feels clogged, then something warm starts dripping — blood. The iron scent is thick, but overlaid with the scent of perfumed roses. @Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs "Thanks for thinking I'm pretty, Quincy." Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:48 PM
God, it was killing him. His throat burned for clean air but he could hardly manage breathing normally at all through his bleeding nose and the wretched smell. He inhaled messily through his mouth, tasting every rotting molecule in the air and fighting the urge to heve onto his shoes. Seven felt his vision blur for a moment as he began to lose focus but continued to drag his feet to the closest exit. Where was he going? He had no clue, just anywhere far enough so that he could gather his vices and clear his mind. Seven pressed himself up against the side of the cave, trying to focus his eye in front of him. The sound of Quincy and Charlotte talking with drowned out by the dripping noises deeper into the cave. Water? Or... There's a pause and the blond props the torch between two rocks before grabbing his disposable camera and bringing it towards the darkest part of the cavern... His shaken, bloodied hand presses down to take a picture, a harsh flash coming from the lens. Can he see what's ahead? @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 04-Nov-22 09:02 PM
So sweet. So charming. Reminds Charlotte of a puppy that kept following her back in the city. It kept her company for a good amount of time; she fed it, kept it warm, kissed its head, and all it did was return that love in such a simple, genuine way that Charlotte couldn't help but feel endeared to it. But that's what simple love is like. There’s no good reason to get attached. They change form on a whim, and eventually they disappear into nothingness. For the brief moment that they touch your palm, you feel affection for them; you might be deeply moved. But the feeling only lasts for that moment. That’s all there is to it. The raindrop that Quincy is to Charlotte is at its moment of precipitation. When the rain leaves, will Quincy too? She brings up her hand to cup her palm and smiles against Quincy's hand, gentle. In the dark, the only thing you can see is the white of her teeth. "I'll make you remember me," she promises. "What do you want? A real kiss?" @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf Seven, you may not know it, but you've lost your way. Your feet make you want to go one direction but you go to another, heading downwards, deeper and deeper. Click! Your camera takes a photo. It takes a while to process. You can imagine you hear breathing, the pained cries of a mouth opening and closing, gasping for air that won't come. The gutted-through lung of a fish. The pitiful roar of a bear. The please, help of a human that might've echoed years past. Your camera takes a photo, and... there is something in the middle of it. That something is a stain of blood. Wet, freshly killed, soaking into the ground and tracing the inscriptions on the wall, painting it a deep, rotten red. It smells so bad. Now that you're so close to it, you wonder how you could've ever thought it was something else, like flowers. (Like a certain person who asked you to jump off a cliff, maybe?) One thing is for certain — that blood is too much for someone to survive. If someone died here, then they should be dead. @Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs

Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 09:11 PM

She spasms and you can see some sort of darkness crawl up through her veins and coat her neck. When you look down at your hands you can barely see yourself — it's covered with that inky darkness, the same pattern of the cave flowing over you. The cave tremors, and you tremor with it, watching as gouges appear with no pain, the same symbol knotting over your skin in that jet black ink. The net is cast, and the fish have come. We will have a bountiful harvest indeed.

19:42
Caiguang and Sanghoon, you can feel the eyes of something staring at you. If you glance back up, you might be able to see that the portraits you observed on your way in... have started to shift. Darker hair, redder eyes. The benevolent looking good seems... different, but you can't quite seem to place your finger on the emotion. All of you get a foreboding sense that something is missing, a sudden emptiness in the heart where something you should have had.... seems to ebb and flow. Your head hurts. Your heart aches. But rationally, you all know that these emotions don't belong to you. You think you have time to look at one more object. A foreboding sense that something is missing? He's had that since he woke up. He swallowed the feeling and pressed on. Tucking the rusted box into his pocket, he'd open it later. For now, he *opens the jewelry box. What does it contain? Anything of value, mostly for the investigation. @dodo | luka
Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 04-Nov-22 07:50 PM
His head hurts, his heart hurts -- It's nothing new, really. The only difference is the source, and separation. It's not his, even if it feels otherwise so. The weight of someone watching is what draws his attention; unnerving for some, but just... Another feeling, mixed and blended with the rest. He approaches the portraits. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 07:50 PM
5/4. The jewelry box contains a small ring. Delicately made. A silver band with a small wine-red jewel inlaid the ring. On the inside is a small etching.
with my heart.
It's a little out of place in the room. Your headache gets worse, you can feel the eyes of the river god staring down at you. @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

Sang-hoon BOT 04-Nov-22 07:51 PM
The hair on the back of its neck stands, survival instincts kicking in as it feels eyes boring into it from behind. Sang-hoon looks around after tucking the talismen away, finding only the paintings that seem out of place here. It feels like a horror movie or something... but Sang-hoon isn't the kind of person that gets frightened very easily, and tries to shake off the uneasiness that uncharacteristically washes over them. It feels unnatural and disgusting, whatever these emotions are. "How long are we supposed to wait in here? I wanna go back already." It mindlessly complains.
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 07:52 PM

The dragon king is one of rivers and oceans, the blue waves that crash onto shore with a sea spray. This portrait runs red. Red runs through you. Your nose starts to bleed. dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 08:13 PM
The painting tears, and ink starts pouring from the cut. It douses the bottom of the room, covering the floor in ink, as the inscriptions on the wall get bolder, and darker. There's a slight burning sensation on your bodies, but it's easy to ignore amongst the splitting headache all three of you seem to be sharing. The inscription etches itself into your minds... if you closed your eyes, you'd be able to retrace it... line by line, mark for mark. Soon, you can something trickle out of your noses as well, if you wipe at it.... well it's red, and smells like rust. Another nosebleed. Now you all have a 5 minute timer together... Tick. Tick. Tick. The door slides open. The shaman returns, breathing heavily as if they were back from a sprint. He murmurs something under his breath, though it's difficult for any of you to catch at he shuffles around the room, disregarding the already opened drawers. As if taking a second look around the room, they seem to notice the three of you in your predicament. "It's here too." They reach into their sleeve, bringing out a yellow slip of paper that they unceremoniously slap onto your foreheads. The headache subsides, if only for a bit... but enough so that you were coherent enough to hear their next words. "Side door, you can leave through this way. Quickly." Do you trust them? @gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley @hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
Sang-hoon BOT 04-Nov-22 08:21 PM
"What took you so long..." They murmur under their breath, the pain causing them to stumble until it's briefly relieved by the strange paper now attached to their forehead. Normally, they're able to handle sheer pain with willpower alone, often ignoring it to push through out of a mix of some pride and arrogance, but this time... it might be too much for even Sang-hoon to handle. This is the kind of pain that can't be seen or understood, only something that can be felt. Ultimately, they don't know how to deal with it. Sang-hoon grabs both Caiguang and Ashley, and starts trudging through what they think is ink. There's too much of a sense of urgency to try and figure out another way to leave. They have no choice but to trust them. @dodo | luka + cai and ash

dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 08:31 PM
You enter the side room, though it wasn't really a room at all. It was a long and winding hall, a one-way street to god knows where. The shaman doesn't seem to follow you though. Do you want them to? Your headaches seem to subside, a dull ache acting as a reminder of what had just transpired. The paper hangs across your foreheads, and at this rate, it really did look like you were a trio of zombies trudging forward. The nosebleeds stop, the ink seems to fade away... almost as if nothing had ever happened in the first place... well, aside from the headache. Replacing the scent of rust, is a sweet, sweet smell of something unfamiliar. Addicting, intoxicating, and yet the path continues deeper until you hit another door. dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 06:43 PM

They seem to hesitate, as if they want to tell Adrian a little more, but they pause to mull it over. "You should head back before it gets too dark." @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 06:48 PM
He notices the pause, but he's not certain how to broach the gap. Adrian glances around at the trees. "...Don't suppose there are wild animals out and about at night? Or even worse, um—what do you call them here? Anomalies?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 06:54 PM

"No it's just... better to be indoors at night. Cold evenings and all." They brush past the sentence, waving their hands against their words. "It's November already, and the ocean breeze gets really chilly this time of year." @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 06:57 PM

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 07:10 PM

I'm actually Korean myself, so this is of great interest to me. You mentioned possessions.." Her voice takes on a note of grandeur, enough to convey interest on the verge of something more. "Have you ever conducted any rituals here? You yourself, or an ancestor of some kind?" Regarding the comment about the shirt, she undoes the tie, instead using it as a... gaudy headband, which felt more acceptable. "I actually used to live in a fairly rural village myself," she continues, nodding. "Eugene is usually what I go by here, but you can call me Eunji." @dodo | luka

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 07:54 PM
Of all five senses, it's typically the sense of smell that triggers memory strongest. The scent isn't unfamiliar, and bile rises to meet the hand clamped over her mouth and nose with an abruptness that barely grants her the chance to cough, to regain some semblance of rationality that isn't overpowered by that sickening sweet. Her eyes squint instinctively, and she takes a moment to regain her footing before following in Adrian's footsteps. "I know," comes her muffled response, dread sinking into her skin like needles at the thought of having to inhale that sweetness once more. Is it coming from the bushes? Or did it only get stronger in the presence of the newcomer? Was it a smell that clung to Suu at all? One either of them might've caught a whiff of prior? @dodo | luka @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 08:00 PM
Each step you take closer to the tree. Is another breath of the sweet, sickly, nauseating air. It gets worse as you continue on. Worse as you take every step closer. Get down. Quick. Suu forgot to tell you to stay. Your hearts start pounding as you get closer to the tree. You could tell, it wasn't a result of your own emotions, but a physical reaction to the scent you crept closer towards the tree. You're standing right next to the tree, but it feels like you're standing on top of a rotting grave. The sickly sweet scent covering up the stench of something rotting... Strangely enough, it does remind you of Suu. Heart pounding, head aching, the previously crisp and clean cloth tied to the trees were stained (in ink? or blood? it's too dark to adequately be able to tell). The sun sets quickly in November. The writings scrawled on there are impossible to decipher, but they etch themselves into your minds. You feel like throwing up. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:04 PM
Adrian swallows roughly against the nausea welling up in his throat. Fumbling for the nearest cloth, he tries his best to pull one off the tree, stuffing it into his pocket. Holding his breath, he tries his best to get away from the tree—stumbling into the bushes, but towards the direction that Suu was headed in. The smell is sickening. Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:10 PM
Helpless against wave after crashing wave of nausea, she watches with one eye screwed shut as Adrian pockets a cloth, hissing past clenched teeth, "don't," but the sound is lost in another shuddering intake of breath. @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys Her eyes are drawn to the cloth, magnetic, and she tries to make out the writings, even as they flood her mind. Her hand presses flat against the bark, wanting to feel something other than just wood. Just how many bodies were buried here? Mounds of dirt weren't uncommon gravemarkers, but this tree— there was evidently something wrong here. And buried here. Why does it remind her of Suu? Nails biting into the bark, she looks, hard, at the cloth, the branches, the dirt, for something, even as she feels her head swimming, drowning, in that sweetness. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 08:19 PM
It's hot. Your hand burns. Feels like it's burning. There's no fire. There's no heat. Just the slithering sensation of something crawling up your skin, inch by inch it creeps, a slow and steady movement from the cloth to your arm. It's painful, but not as much as the headache you need to nurse. What is a little pain in the advent of a greater discovery? The thorns against your sides don't matter, the tears in your clothes are inconsequential, the dirt that clings to your socks can all be ignored. But are you leaving Eunji behind? Every step you take away from the tree takes you away from the smell you want to leave behind... but brings you closer to an empty aching in your heart. These feelings aren't yours but you feel them regardless. @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
20:23
All you can feel is the wood against your palm, the dirt against your knees, the burning of your eyes as you continue to learn and remember. The lines of the inscription etch an intricate web, and you know yourself that you have already been caught within its lure. It clings to you, holds you down as you remain in the center of it all. (But what was it in the first place anyways). How long did you plan on sitting here? Until you became one with the dirt once and for all? @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:31 PM
She wants to dig grooves into the skin of this damned tree. She wants to leave a mark. She wants it to burn. The lighter she carries burns from where it sits, deep in her pocket, and her palms still lie flat against the trunk of the tree. still inhaling that queasy sweet. The question that's posed is not her own thought, but it comes up regardless. Whatever answers she sought, she wouldn't be getting here, was that it? Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:31 PM
He can't trust his own eyes—he knows that for a fact. His thoughts come in splintered waves, the cloths around him splattered with bloody ink-stains. They weren't there before, and he's not even sure if they're there now. He needs tangible proof—needs to get away from this place and recollect his thoughts. The feelings aren't his. He knows that as soon as they hit him, stark and alien in their immediacy, but the hollow ache in his chest is almost familiar. Would he leave Eunji behind? Adrian grits his teeth, continuing forward—if he was caught in the anomaly's trap, he would be as useless to her as if he left her behind. He needs to be sane and lucid to help himself, much less anyone else. (A part of him is unconvinced. A part of him knows it doesn't matter who it was, or what was happening. A part of him recognizes his own selfishness, his own guiltlessness, his own stubborn inability to recognize his own callousness even when it stares him in the face.) He pushes forward. @dodo | luka @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 08:38 PM
You run, you walk, you crawl. These bushes weren't here before... but they are now. Another obstacle in your way, something always, always wanted to make things harder for you. With little choice but to continue on, you make your way to the fringes of the ceremonial site, the edge where it all began. It was only a few meters, so why did it feel like an eternity? Suu stands in front of you, back turned away as their gaze follows an empty path. They make no comment about your worn appearance, the dirt and wear that had managed to etch itself onto your bodies. They stand there. Silently... until they spoke. "What do you think makes a god?" @st. namulas 🃏 eunji @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:45 PM
The scent's faded, now, though dirt still cling to the beds of her fingernails, splintered chips of wood finding purchase in her skin. It takes a moment to find her voice, and another, longer, moment to even want to address the question at all. "What was that?" she croaks, when she'd had every intention to snarl. Certainly, there was something wrong with this town, but to gloss over that smell, that exchange, all that had happened. "Who are you?" she barks, but still, her voice is weak, feeble. The pent up aggression and hostility and terror she'd felt seizes in her throat, and dies there. Wobbling to stand up proper, Eunji massages her neck, wipes at her nose. Anything to unclog that scent, that still seemed to cling to every inch of her. "What do you think makes a god? Have you the audacity to ask such a thing now?" she asks, "answer our questions first." @dodo | luka

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 08:48 PM
Fucking hell. He's tired of humoring this kind of thing. But he speaks regardless, running a hand through his disheveled hair and grimacing at the tugging burn running through his fingers, his palm, his arm, his side—old injuries, blending with the new. "Power?" Adrian tries, wearily. Eunji's anger surprises him, though perhaps he should have expected this. As for him, there's nothing but the constant hollowed echoing ache in his chest, his head. He breathes out a dry laugh. Everyone wants to be a philosopher, apparently. "People believe in what they hope will bring order. What explains something fundamental about the world. They want to believe that there's something greater than themselves, something great enough to ensure that the world adheres to strict rules. That things are fair. That the wicked are punished." dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 09:00 PM
Suu makes no motion to turn back towards the duo, gaze turned far towards the distance. Silly question, wasn't it? dodo | luka 04-Nov-22 09:35 PM
"Aww you guys make me so shy. Don't scream okay?" They pull down the veil, revealing quite the ordinary face, save for the slow crawl of black ink that moved across their body. Much like the ones that were beginning to crawl across your own. The same familiar markings that were etched onto the cloth before, the inscriptions that buried themsleves in your minds, that burned into your gaze, that was beginning to crawl across your bodies. Those same inscriptions seemed to morph across the lower half of Suu's face, weaving itself around as if it were the only thing holding the structure of their body together. It's grotesque, it's hypnotizing, it's a myriad of emotions too difficult to explain. "Sorry... I really wanted to tell you the full story myself... but it looks like I was too late for that." Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 04-Nov-22 09:39 PM
Fuck. The ground, all of a sudden, is quite close to his face. Adrian's vision falters, wavering—he makes a last ditch attempt to pull out his walkie-talkie, black ink crawling across his hands as he mutters a few disjointed words into the receiver.
2
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 04-Nov-22 09:53 PM
Whatever protests she has tumble gracelessly and fall flat onto the ground below. The ink blooms, first, in her mind. Sinking into the blank sheet of parchment, marring its textured surface with endless darkness, and it spreads, and it consumes. Her thoughts struggle to override the words they utter, the phrases, the names, the prayers. Whatever that had been written on those strips of cloth, on that tree, still haunt the frames of her mind, the walls of her head, and she is hopelessly at their mercy. From white to yellow to orange to red to blood to black. It is a pattern that they too have no choice but to follow, a path laid out for their feet that their bodies trudge along mindlessly. She stands— she thinks she does— but her knees buckle, her hand struggling to catch where she'd been perched before. Something knocks against her head, or perhaps its the reverse— and the hypnotic scrawlings of madmen stretch beyond the vast caverns of inner walls, punching through.... Through her chest, first. It feels like she's been punctured for a moment, then. The ache gnaws at her heart, it burns. She feels like she's being consumed. Is she? It isn't foreign, this feeling. She wonders how the sun feels during an eclipse. Swallowed by that darkness, slow and steady. She wonders if she'll come out the other side. She wonders if she wants to. Ink blots her vision, dances across her eyes. So brilliant and yellow, the fire still burns, roils, and she chokes out a word, a phrase, a segment of something, but ink stains her tongue too, and all she can taste is that darkness, coating every inch of her. It's disgusting. Her gaze darts, poisonous, to Suu. But as the void swarms, leaving in its wake nothing but the halo of her pupils, fear leaves her feeling colder than ever. Her hand reaches for Adrian, something to remind her that they aren't alone, but all she finds is dirt, and after that, nothing.
4
3
2
dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 01:36 PM
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 02:03 PM
[ you feel yourself succumb to the darkness ] It's not new, by any means. The scene that played before you slowly fades away from the edges, a small reminder that what you were experiencing now... couldn't last forever. How long had you been in that dream anyways? Moments? Eons? All you knew was that it was time to move on... But to where? The burning sensation on your bodies resurface, your eye, or leg, or arm, heart even. Wherever it had originated from, the feeling seemed as if it would start spreading, like a disease that finally set root and decided that it was ready to feast. The meal, in this case, was you. The pain causes you to wake, to blink blearily against the light that shone against your face, the chilly autumn wind that had you shudder before looking up at the scene before you. The vile stench that seemed to make its way back, intertwined with the sickly sweet smell that clung to your bodies. Sugar and spice, everything nice, heaped onto anything whatever was the source of the festering rot that threatened to carve into you from the inside out. The plum blossoms fell. They're sweet. They're disgusting. ...
14:03
Catching your bearings, you realize the following about the immediate area.
- Your head hurts. Awfully. - Your hands are bound behind your body. It's impossible to get out of... Alone anyways. - Aside from Luka, all your coworkers are with you. - You have pieces of yellow paper stuck on your bodies. - Sang-hoon... the talismans from your pocket are gone.
In the surrounding area, you see:
- The tree in full bloom. The sweet scent comes from there. - A figure in black, slumped to the ground in front of it. - A figure in white, kneeling on the ground, speaking agitatedly to someone in front of them. - Their conversation partner? A pink-haired lady, whose skin was almost completely obscured by the markings. - You can't hear what they're saying.
In the far distance, you see...
- Another figure... making their way towards the area.
Your head spins and body aches. You can't remember the last time you felt this awful... [ All detectives ] have -2 to every roll they make, after modifiers. [ TIMA ], [ SEVEN ], [ CAIGUANG ], [ SANG-HOON ], and [ ADRIAN ], have an additional -1 to every roll. (TOTAL -3). ;In the face of such despair, will you be able to make it out?

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 06-Nov-22 02:28 PM

Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 06-Nov-22 02:28 PM
A sharp intake of breath and then a groan as Seven feels every inch of his body from the tips of his toes to his temples pulse from pain. He blinks blearily past the headache and tries to focus his eye on what's in front of him. He counts the detectives... one... two... everyone seemed to be here except Luka. He then tries to remember what he was doing last and as the last of the dream finally filters away he stares down at his feet in disappointment. Mostly to himself. One point to the anomaly. Again. "Is everyone alright?" He whispers softly to the others. He figured it was a dumb question, but if there were any physical injuries it was better to take count of it now than later.

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 06-Nov-22 02:33 PM
He finally gets his fingers around a handle, drawing out the blade clumsily—it nicks a finger as it goes, and Adrian grimaces, but he manages to get a grip on it, doing his best to fumble around to find the thick knots binding Sang-hoon's hands in place. Trying not to draw too much attention to his actions, he starts to slice through the ropes, keeping his gaze neutral and aimed down at the ground. While he's at it, he examines the others: is there anything written on the slips of yellow paper attached to them...? Where are the slips stuck to on each person?

Adrian frowns, eyes darting around to his colleagues as he sits there uselessly. There's blood on his face—or bile, he can't tell. There's a mirroring taste on the back of his tongue.

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 06-Nov-22 03:32 PM

She tosses her gun to the nearest detective, freeing its cool heavy metal from where it was digging into her stomach,— Sang-hoon, and kicks the knife towards them too. dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 03:34 PM
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
15:35
With a tremor the earth shakes, the leaves on the tree rustling as the wind blows through the branches. The shaman in white, writhes on the ground-- he can't respond to your pleas, not when he's coughing up copious amounts of black liquid... with no end in sight. His hands grab at the blindfold around his eyes, the knuckles on his hands turning white as he struggles to keep his bearings in mind. and then she gets up. There's a creaking noise as she stands, her body assembling itself in ways you don't expect a human body should be able to act. Step by step, she manages to pick herself up, using the tree to her leverage... as a prop, in order to stand on her own two feet. Her head turns to look at you. Familiar burgundy red eyes that bore into your skulls. The veil falls off at this point, revealing a face half-rotting underneath. It's unpleasant to look at... but you remember her asking you a question before... Are you squeamish? I'll cry if you scream. Half lidded eyes where she turns her gaze from the bloodied body of Charlotte on the ground passing by every detective before making her way... slowly... step by step towards the surrounding people. The blood drips from the side of her head, where the droplets slowly fall to the ground. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums @guided

Her grip tightens around the knife, and with the full weight of her fury, her terror, her grief, she plunges the knife through his hands as they come near— Bringing up her forearm to take the brunt of the damage, she tries to kick for his stomach, still digging the blade up until the hilt through the flesh of his hand, unfettered by bone, by muscle, by sinew. One eye screws shut as nails catch flesh, an indubital sentencing of scarring. Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 06-Nov-22 04:02 PM
A whir of pain pulls at his hair. He wonders what it would be like, to finally die. The moment never comes. Instead, he is hurled to the ground -- limp, sharp pain, tingling pain, ringing ears, deafening screams, with a warm liquid dripping down his neck. If this is what it means to be alive, he can't say he's missed much. Maybe if he closed his eyes, this whole ordeal would blow over. Eunji and Ashley -- He thinks they're the reason he has the opportunity to feel this pain, again. They're detectives of LQCC. Capable. They help the ordeal blow over, while he sits and accepts what's the come. He'd call it a nice sight up close -- to see his coworkers working together -- but all they were doing was battering at a murderous old man. Which, was more than he could do. He doesn't know if he'd have the heart to hit him still. "This is a lot of blood, hehe." @Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs

In the aftermath, you see inscriptions begin to appear, spreading from his hands and his side, covering his entire body. 'Suu' clutches at her head in her hands, groaning noises as her face begins to.... restructure itself. If anyone looked at Charlotte's body, they would notice that the inscriptions on her body have covered her completely, leaving her to look like nothing more than a black husk of a person. The same could be said for the old man, as his lifeless body follows suit, as the light from his eyes fades, and his hands grow limp... How many people have you seen die today? How many more will you see fall at the actions of your hands? Now... Suu looks just as they did when you first saw her... normal once again, slumped over ???'s shoulder as she lets out a heavy sigh. 5
17:07
The entry reads as follows... it's actually a little clipping, torn out and taped into this journal.
SYCOPHANT ; a supernatural anomaly often compared to daemons and mythological anomalies due to their similar natures. However, there are key differences that set them apart. In nature, sycophants are more aligned with parasites due to the one-sided relationship with the host. Unlike angels, sycophants do not directly give their host anomalous abilities. Instead, they strengthen themselves using their host, and in turn, develop anomalous abilities based on their host’s beliefs. During its developmental stage, sycophants rely on their host's to shape their own self. By nature, they gravitate towards calm and well-natured individuals as a means to prolong their own lives, as theirs are directly tied to their hosts. They usually develop into mythological figures the host is familiar with, and can form special abilities accordingly. Typically this manifests itself in small ways, such as attracting fish towards a body of water if the host was a fisherman, or bringing a small shower if the host was a farmer. Most often, they are unnoticeable by humans and generally just bring a little bit of “good luck”.
@guided
17:08
The authorities are on their way, the siblings stand in front of you... It's up to you to make a choice now. You're free to do anything you want... even leave if you wanted. This was out of your scope anyways. You never did find out who sent that note... But does it matter at this point? @guided
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 06-Nov-22 05:10 PM

ASHLEY WALKER BOT 06-Nov-22 06:11 PM
Catches the lighter from mint. Breaks off small branches, gather them under the tree, any dried sticks or twigs to start the flame at the roots, before it consumes the tree as a whole. "All of this stemmed from an anomaly. One based on belief." At this point, are gods even real anymore? "Exploiting a person's memories, grief and belief." Once there's enough, he waits until everyone's ready, to place the two bodies by the tree, or move them away. Whichever they decide. "Belief of a god who might not be there, and using anomalous powers to bring them to fruition. From the beginning, then, are your gods even real?" He asked, to the siblings, mostly but without looking back at them. "I don't think mine was." He lits the ends of the twigs from the base, "The blood of the sacrifice was given to this tree right? If your god is real, then this marks its death. When you're free, what's the first thing you want to do?" He asks the siblings.

1
dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 06:15 PM
The flames lick the base of the tree, as they crawl from the roots to the trunk, to the leaves that shook with pink blossoms. A warm blaze flickers in front of you as the tree easily catches on fire, a warm reprieve in the midst of everything that was going on. The flames dance, the embers sing, the crackling noises continue on as the fire eats away at the tree, by far the most satisfying thing you've seen all day. Fire has a purifying aspect to it... one that burns away at the smell of rust and sugar that hung in the air around you... For the first time today, you manage to get a whiff of the salty sea breeze that came from the coast... You notice the inscriptions on your bodies stop moving, though they don't disappear completely. Somehow, you seem to recall that if you simply just left, then the inscriptions themselves would fade in time... In the shrine, for those of you who visited... he did leave a warning to you... To leave and simply not look back, and then maybe you'll turn out to be alright. If that was the case, all you needed to do was turn heel and leave this awful place. And you hope, because you certainly don't pray... That your actions will do something, that burning the tree will be the answer... that somehow... everyone will be able to go home after this. To enjoy a warm home for tonight... and many more nights to come. The twins don't answer you, one can hardly keep their eyes open, the other stares blankly at the tree. What did they believe? Even if you asked... nothing would be answered. The tree burns itself away, but the twins remain the same. Do you want to CONTINUE? Or do you want to GO HOME? @guided

dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 06:40 PM
After what feels like ages, the paramedics arrive, led by none other than Luka herself. She doesn't have any inscriptions written on her own body (thank god), and she's alive at least... though she does seem to be sporting a couple of her own injuries, none as severe as the rest of yours. In any case, the worst of the injuries start to get treated, Mint's gunshot wound, Caiguang's neck injury... amongst the others scattered between your team. It'll take a couple of days in the hospital before you can begin your trip back to Meteor City... but for now it looks like the rest of you are safe. You pass through the village, desolate at this point... with not a single soul in sight, you briefly wondered what happened before Luka starts to fill you in. "At one point, while you were all gone... All of the people in the village started having these... things written on their arms... Kind of like---" Oh... She points to the inscriptions on your bodies... to you all, they were noticeably fainter than when you first saw them. She coughs into her hand... it looked like a couple more sleepless nights would be in store while she figured out the logistics of everything... for sure, number one on her list would be securing some plane tickets. No way were any of these people ready for another car ride. She makes no comment about the two additions to your party, who have opted to walking on their own... away from the group. You pass through the village gates, arriving by the cliffside, where you're hit with the salty spray of the breeze... And before you can get another word in.
"Sorry..."
"I think this is where I have to stop."
18:40
You recognize it as "Suu", the low melancholic voice ringing out to you as she heads towards the cliff's edge, teetering the boundary between cliff and air. To some of you, this scene is all to familiar now. A picture in which one person falls... and another person chases. It played out in the exact same way again. "Bin-- no." And the other grasps at her clothes, until they both fall off the cliffside until they drop into the sea. She knew, of the horrors that had been taking place this entire time. The lives that had been sacrificed to uphold her own. It wasn't originally a situation like this... there was a delicate balance that was able to keep everything in stasis, but after it broke down, the cracks could never be repaired. But she wasn't allowed to speak, or take any action... no matter how much she, herself, wanted to die. She was already dead. She was a soul locked into a body that was meant to expire... twenty years ago. How much longer could she keep moving, with fingers that were already cold and stiffening over. So in this moment, maybe she would be the one who could finally end things. Subin cares. She cares more than she'd like to admit actually. She knew that she was getting worse, but the anomaly didn't let her act. But she tried anyways... She feels sorry, apologetic.. Maybe if she tried this the first time around, and never sent that letter in the first place... But regrets and resentments lasted too long for her. She didn't want to hate anymore. She couldn't hate her brother for putting her in this situation, for forcing her to live in a life that was rooted in one place... because in the end, she would have done the same. So perhaps when the ocean waters pull her in, regardless of the arms that try to drag her out... Maybe then she'll be at peace. Thanks for bringing her out.... the ocean view was wonderful. (edited)

1
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 06-Nov-22 07:12 PM
She'd lingered at the end of the group for a number of reasons, mostly to keep an eye on the twins. The village, void of life, of energy, of sound, save for the crunching of gravel underfoot was unsettling, the explanation Luka provided even more so. She couldn't imagine it. Eunji tries to help the siblings, but through muted refusals or something other, she sticks closer to LQCC while on the way back. She doesn't step forward, when the first one falls. Her feet remain rooted where they are, as the other follows. Her mouth parts, but she can't think of what to say. It's so silent, when they die. Not even the crashing of waves disturbs the overwhelming quiet. The wind quiets down to a whisper, and even that, too, feels too loud. Would she have done the same? She turns away, picks at the crusting blood as she wipes her fingers, and thinks to herself to light two more candles, when she gets home.

Sang-hoon BOT 06-Nov-22 07:20 PM
Ultimately, they were two lives that didn't affect it at all. As sad and somber as others around it feel, and as heavy as the world seems, it doesn't think twice about the whole thing. What's done is done, and they've made their choice at the end of it, much like the rest of them did. ...If everyone else died, does that mean...? Sang-hoon taps its chin, a bit curious. It wasn't really going to stay to find out, but there's something sad about the whole thing. At least he went out thinking he had a partner somewhere, though Sang-hoon was never the kind of person to do things out of good will. That was simply a happy coincidence. It turns on its heel, ready to leave, looking back for only a moment to notice Eunji staying behind. It gives her a moment, looking off in the same view, before approaching from behind and placing a hand on her head. "Hoobae, can't stay here forever either." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji hi

ASHLEY WALKER BOT 06-Nov-22 07:21 PM
The warmth of the burning tree was somewhat comforting after all of that. Eyes closed his conscious was already slipping, too far gone now to truly stay awake. He hears them though, the detectives here and there, the arrival of Luka and medical help. He was always a light sleeper, so he didn't truly fell into deep sleep, but his mind was elsewhere. When opted to stand, he does so, when told to sit somewhere as he gets checked he complies. Whatever questions needs answer he would. Whatever is quickest to let him return to rest. He hears faintly, the sound of the siblings leaving, the crashing waves, and the desperate plea. He was sure they'd fail their mission. There was no one left to save. He wondered what could have been done to prevent it. ... he remembers his senior's words, Olwen as she spoke about her first mission and how it went. How many missions could be unpleasant. He figures this was one of them. Surely when he woke up fresh in that hospital room, the old him was dead. Was this second life a second chance to really live? Or was it a life to be spent atoning for whatever's sins he's made in the past. He wonders if there will be more of these coming. Failures to come from here on out. He closes his eyes again. He hopes at least sleep can be a momentary respite. Until the time comes where he needs to wake up, and the time to fight and fail again returns. He hopes though, next time they'd succeed.
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 06-Nov-22 07:28 PM
Shaken from her quiet stupor by the hand on her head, Eunji slowly turns to Sang-hoon, mouth parting again to dismiss their concern— but it's harder to speak than she anticipated, and the first sound that escaped is a withered sound, dry in her throat. A soft wheeze that she coughs into a fist to clear, and some color comes back to her face. "Sorry. Did you worry?" she asks with half of a smile, eyes falling back down to her hands. It's harder to clean than she'd anticipated. Her half-hearted attempt to joke falls flat, but she's trying nonetheless. @hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
Sang-hoon BOT 06-Nov-22 07:37 PM
"Worried? No, not really," and that's the truth, because it's sure she can pick herself up at the end of the day. Still, its gaze follows hers, stopping at her hands. "You know, it's harder to clean shit off when you have no water." Their hand releases her head, having messed up several strands of hair in the process, and points at her. "You hungry? I'm seriously starving, but I don't think this place even has any good food nearby." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 06-Nov-22 07:42 PM
The smile she offers it is more genuine this time around, and she tries to comb her hair somewhat, to no avail. It shouldn't worry. "I have a wet wipe, but it's sort of..." she dangles the rust-stained wipe between her thumb and forefinger. Her gaze shifts to the finger pointing at her, blinking back surprise. "... I'm starving, actually," she admits with a laugh, one that rings less hollow, now. "Will Sunbae be treating their Hoobae to a warm meal?" Sliding her hands into some latex gloves for the time being, she ties her hair back and slides into the I <3 WASHINGTON shirt she'd purchased prior, just in case. Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 06-Nov-22 07:45 PM
Please, save them. In the end, he can't really say they've saved anybody. Just themselves, and people in the future, but the people that disappeared? The people stuck in a cycle? To want to help everyone, perhaps that was blind optimism. If your mother and your wife were drowning in the ocean, who would you save? He remembers that sort of question pop up before, and his answer was always: Just save them both. Reality is different than hypotheticals. It tells you what you can and can't do, that you bite off more than you can chew, that both will drown if you want to have your cake and eat it too. If the siblings only had each other, and one had to go, then it was only natural for the other to follow. His body, running on the adrenaline of pain, fixated on the technicalities. (The technicalities that, the siblings would survive if they were physically unharmed. But saving had more to do with the body, it had to do with the heart. There was no heart, just mission, so they failed. He failed at something that should be so obvious to him.) Why was he here again? He can't even answer that question, let alone try to breathe a will for life into another. Well, they told him to stay put, until his injuries heal. He curls up on the hospital bed, in attempt to make himself as small as possible. He'll listen -- he always does -- and dream of something more pleasant.

They smile too, a little more empty than Eunji's, but it's a smile nonetheless. "I spent so much money at that gift store, I think I'm broke," they sigh, comically pulling out empty pockets. Their wallet is just in their new backpack, though. "Well, let's go find an ajumma somewhere to make us some nice stew. Maybe she'll have a bathroom too." Sang-hoon pats Eunji on the back, guiding her away from this place. In the end, they'll always take care of people smaller than them. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
