Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 06-Nov-22 07:58 PM
She knows she's lucky. She's alive, isn't she? Isn't she? It's as if there's a thin layer of plastic film separating her from everything. Moments stitch together, fading in and out - the ambulance arriving, the paramedics doing their work, the rest of them filtering out of the eerily empty village. Tima looks back as they exit - to convince herself they really are leaving - and catches a glimpse of that tragic ending. With barely any context, no leftover feelings or memories, it feels like something out of a movie. Washed out in grey-white, she can almost convince herself it's beautiful. She doesn't know them, and she cannot reach them - and that's fine. It's better here, on the outside, isn't it? Caught in that real-not real liminal space. She smiles. ( Later, she'll sit on the plane, pinching herself awake, and try to pretend like she's not desperately afraid of waking back up in that house, surrounded by the smell of corpses and fire. But for now, she can be grateful for the uncertainty.)
6
dodo | luka 06-Nov-22 08:27 PM
EPILOGUE The incantation slowly fades from your bodies, the markings disappearing as the silhouette of Subin fades into the sea. The bubbles rise up as the tide carries on... and for a while you feel... a whole set of emotions. Mixed feelings where you were relieved that the situation resolved itself, or upset that things had to end this way... Some stories don't allow themselves to have a happy ending, nor do they wrap up as cleanly as you wanted them to. In the end, all that you had were your own experiences and memories to hold onto. May you dream a better dream from this night to the next. As you finally board the ambulance... or the van, whichever suited your current needs the best, you found yourselves hesitating. You knew what had happened in the village... and what you had done. You remember clearly the events that unfolded before your eyes. A strange incantation that marked itself upon your skin, a numbing experience where you dreamt a dream to make yourself whole-- or didn't. Then the next day... a day where you met with... the village chief... and the lady named Charlotte, and the... You pause. It's difficult to remember that scene right now. But then you remember two individuals... who seemed to be at the core of it all... but neither their faces nor their names seemed to ring any bells. You couldn't remember what they looked like, only flashes of white or flashes of black mixed in with red and gold... But the finer details seemed to escape you. Their names, their roles in the story. You remember you had a younger sister (or did you?) for only a brief moment... and that she loved you very much, more so than you could ever hope to reciprocate. Or maybe you didn't feel anything of that sort at all. Perhaps you can remember the warmth of the sunlight as you basked in the afternoon sun in a dream that you once dreamt. (edited)
20:27
But names escape you. Faces do too. You hold a warm memory deep in your heart. You survived, that's what matters most right now. The people around you survived... that's what mattered next. Did you accomplish anything? You brought solace to the hearts of those in pain. You helped travelers who lost their way find the route home. You let someone take one last look at the ocean view. Letting go is never easy, but your presence alone can make things worthwhile. Sometimes, something small like that is good enough to make it worth it. Save them, the slip of paper asked of you. But what did that entail actually? To continue letting a person live, even if their life had already expired twenty years ago? To allow them to continue on despite the countless lives lost in a sacrifice they didn't wish to make? In your own way, you saved them already. That little bit of solace tugs at the corner of your shirt. Remember what you have done, what you have lost, and what you have loved. You shuffle through the journal that you accidentally brought back with you, pages making themselves clear now that they were no longer marred by the jet black ink of the anomaly's last grasps. You see one last journal entry, written in a handwriting that was unfamiliar to you.
The living must continue the burden of survival, the dead should be laid to rest. Though you may mourn the lives of those that have been lost, rest easy in the fact that their life lives on in the memory you hold.
The entry ends there, and whether or not you read it, may your heart be a little lighter while carrying the yoke of life.
20:27
[ Detectives ] remember the full extent of the events that have happened in the past few days. However, every memory of [ the shamans ] is blurred from their memory. They remember that they interacted with a [ psychic ], but cannot place a [ name ] or a [ face ]. All they remember, are [ wine-red ] colored [ eyes ]. Every instance of [ Subin, "Suu", or the black-clothed individual ], is replaced by the other. To you, there was only [ one shaman ], whose identity you can't recall. On the coastal shore, an individual washes onto the beach. Clothed in white, with a red sash across his body. In his hands are a black cloak, and a single golden earring.

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:22 PM
[THE DARKNESS OPENS WIDE AROUND YOU...] ;Welcoming, recognizing — one of their own. At this point, you know the formula. You get in there, something gets in your mind and uses your experiences against you, you have to give up something again, over and repeat, a rinse cycle that's harder to get out your clothes than bloodstains will ever inflict. You're tired of it all. And still you chose to come on this mission. Do you remember why you became a detective? And for what reason? Do you still think you'll find something about him if you search long enough? The darkness is a pinprick against a backdrop of white, suddenly. That white delineates into washed cobblestone and faded colors of a suburb — somewhere you've never lived in your entire life, but have seen plenty of in Meteor City. And this city is like Meteor City, but not quite. It's not that dark or run-down, and it's a little humbler, no noise of the street deafening you as you tear your gaze from the wall and find yourself in front of a merrily lit bakery, watching as your sibling companion-to-be crouches over a fat cat, grinning from ear to ear as she smooths the fur on its white head. "We should take you home and give you a bath and a nice widdle hug," she coos, laughing as the cat purrs, pushing its head into her hand.
@xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:37 PM
Darkness gives way to light. He looks around, taking in his surroundings. Where was he? Ink stains like blood. A burning in his arm. The prickling coldness on the back of his neck that tells him something is very wrong. And— “Who…” His words trail off as he takes in the scene. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums stumbling in here spr late
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:55 PM
"I'm thinking of naming her 'Baby,'" she confides in you, taking the question in an entirely different direction. She raises the fat cat slightly off the ground to wave a paw at you, her brother. Turns out that's the upper limit of the cat's patience. It bites her hand, making her release it, and she groans as she stands up, staring down at her hand glumly as she rubs at the reddened skin. "Bin-ah, I think I'm bleeding," she whines. Maybe you shouldn't have done something so stupid, then.
@xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:25 PM
A sister? He… Does, but he doesn’t. It’s hard to say. He hasn’t spoken to… …It’s been a while. Adrian steps closer, examining the girl. “It’s just a scratch.” Bin…? Can he recognize where he is? “Speaking of home…” Adrian hesitates, frowning. Play along? ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 05:01 PM
"Do you think it has rabies?" She frets. "Luckily we got those shots at the start of the year." Home... she tucks her hair behind her ear as she looks out into the night. You get the sense she ran, a little, and you chased because you weren't allowed to leave her alone. Filial piety, or... even some emotion-driven reason like you cared about her. Whatever. It isn't easy to admit. The point was that you needed to make sure she was safe, with all the busy emotions that came with that statement. She chews on her cheek. She's still rubbing her hand; it's stopped bleeding now. "I'll behave. I just wanted to walk around somewhere that wasn't the hotel, you know."
@xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:08 PM
Yeah. He's played this kind of game before. He's had a sibling. Giving chase, and for what? Can he say that it's really because he cares? It's hard to say. Easier to deal with things he can see, things he can shoot, things he can come home from at the end of the day. Things he can pretend don't affect him in the way they do. Seattle. It's a start. A clue. If only he could get her name, somehow... "Yeah. Sure. Anywhere in particular you wanted to go...?" It's almost familiar, in a jarring way. Memories superimpose themselves on one another. Another time, another place, another prodigal sibling. Adrian pauses. He's never very good at this kind of thing, never has been. "Are you okay? Really." Funny how it's easier for him to say it to a stranger.
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 05:30 PM
Parallel lines. They never touch, there is no point of contact, but somewhere else in the world was still an older brother dealing with his younger sibling who felt too much at times, but you still had a duty to each other. Because that is what family is. In the end, just because you were born, it was something you had to fulfill. "Playground," she says near-immediately. You didn't really have them back at home, or you did but you preferred to stay in and read, and by the time you were old enough to actually appreciate it, the spring of your youth has passed and it's just... pathetic. @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:48 PM
Is is the anomaly that makes him play along, that makes a rare pang of something like sympathy ring out in his chest? Something resonates either way, string to string. Duty. Obligation. He knows the taste well. Family, on the other hand—he's not too sure what that means, not anymore. "Playground," he murmurs, an echo. A ghost. Youth—is he still young? He supposes so. He feels tired, though. So tired. Every mission is another exhausting rush, another danger to face down, another day of wondering whether he'll come home in the end. At some point, he'd stopped caring about that so much. At some point, it'd all seemed the same. Better to do something that still felt like anything at all. "Yeah," he replies. "Sometimes I don't really feel like I'm here, either." A wry smile tugs at the corner of his lips. It's a rare admission that actually feels like truth. His eyes drift over to her face, examining her features—familiar? Who is she? Can he—or not him, not really, but the person he's haunting—can he remember?
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 06:21 PM
She is your twin. What was one became two, or what had been two was originally one all along. Choi Subin, half of a whole, not whole without her half. And you — or the person you are currently using to view this through — is her other half. In fact, the glimpses you caught of yourself in the mirror matched up. Dark hair, red eyes. "I know it's a little hard to be tied down," she continues saying, "but if you feel like you're floating away, let me be your anchor. I can't really leave you to be by yourself. What are siblings for if not a thorn in their sibling's side," and she laughs, a little self-deprecatingly. The street lamps are light shadow light, and you eventually end up in a suburban, well-kept playground, colorful iron bars and slides and a pair of swings. She takes one and there's one more, beside her. She takes out a camera. "Can I take pictures?"
@xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:39 PM
A twin. Sometimes Adrian thinks about it—what it would be like. To have a sibling is to have a version of yourself reflected back at you—and for all Yuhui's stubbornness and rashness and irreverence and blind, irrational anger, Adrian can't convince himself that it's not understandable, that it's not relatable. The mirror doesn't have to be real to be a mirror. He's seen himself reflected in it all his life. "Thank you," he says, words catching, faltering. When's the last time he was at a place like this? A playground. It must have been years. Adrian drifts over to the swing next to her. "Sure." A pause. Adrian looks up at the sky, legs dangling down and shoes scraping against the ground. It's a peaceful moment. He hates to break the atmosphere—doesn't want to pollute someone else's memory. And yet. There's always a job to be done. And peaceful moments never last, not really. "Do you remember something..." he starts, gaze dropping to the ground. "Something about a ceremony, a village...?"
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 06:59 PM
There is light pollution in Seattle, but not to the point where the stars can't be seen. And here, far away from the roads and the noise and everything that can be distracting, it's nice to let yourself soak in the vibes for a while, put your roots down when it came to it. She fiddles with an expensive-looking camera, checking the shutter speed for nighttime photography before she looks up. "Do you?" She sounds accusatory, leaning forward to brush your bangs away from your head as she checks for an injury. You're the older one, but she's the one who still takes care of you. After she checks, she leans back sufficiently, chains rattling as she settles on a precarious position, leaning against the chain as it digs into her cheek. "Of course I do. We'll have to go back tomorrow because mom needs to do the ritual. But she snuck us out because I wanted some ice cream." She kicks the gravel on the ground, frowning. "I was selfish. I just wanted to spend more time with you and her and dad, really." She sighs. "I'm already fourteen. I need to grow up."

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:17 PM

Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 08:24 PM
“Old enough for ice cream, maybe. Maybe not other things.” Adrian’s brow furrows as he puts some of the puzzle pieces together. Shaman’s children, with an inherited mantle. And an inherited curse? A life for a life… “I know. It’s nice not to be alone.” Is it? He wonders himself. Is he alone now? As close as he gets to other people—has he ever really been known? Adrian watches her reach out. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 08:48 PM
She finds the touch as awkward as you think, in your head. She just imitates what she sees on television shows and movies, of twins that are close and have no flaw, of a family that will fight but always make up. The truth is that her hands are cold and clammy, and she flees from your touch just as much as you do, eyes downcast. There's no disappointment; you two have taken care of each other in another way that's not so easily understood. It was her bad for thinking something different. It's nice not to be alone. She nods, a little belatedly, to that statement, then raises her eyes to look at you, red on red. "...I don't know." She sort of thought, maybe, you'd have the answers. She stares for a bit but looks out, to the point where you can't see her expression. "If I ran away... what would you do? I don't know if I can take living this kind of life anymore." A rare note of frustration enters his voice. His? Oh. It's him. And you're back to being you, because this has always been about family. He ducks his head, looking at you. His hair is undyed, but that'll change in the coming months. The expression is still fierce. "And don't tell me I can't, because — you can't do that."
@xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 08:57 PM
Oh. It’s the sense of the uncanny again, of the knowledge that this isn’t real. Siblings take care of each other—do they? Has he ever been there? Nobody asked for his opinion, back then. Not his father, and not— People leave. They walk out, and Adrian watches them go. Sometimes, he follows. It’s how he’s lived—how he’s been comfortable living. “I know,” he replies, because he does. After that—what more can he say? He understands? (He does.) What would he do? What has he done? Nothing, functionally speaking. A coward’s play—he’s satiated his curiosity. He knows he could end this charade, if he wanted to—knows exactly where Yuhui is, if he wanted to— “I don’t know what I’d do,” he says, because it’s honest. Adrian looks away at the specter in front of him. “Sometimes I think about it too, you know.” (But we’re different. But I can’t do what you do, not in the same way. Because someone has to stay behind. Don’t you understand? This is what I do for you—what I’ve done. Keeping the peace. Ever the scapegoat.) It’s all selfish, and he knows it, so he doesn’t voice any of it. His lips twist. “You should do what you want.” It comes out the wrong way, dismissive, as always. It’s not what he means—not now, anyway. Maybe, back then, things would have been different. Maybe he hasn’t changed at all. He sighs, listening to the breeze and the low creaking of the old swing in counterpoint. “Where would you go?”
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 09:16 PM
Damn. They both don't have answers. Your brother is still 14, but you're older now, too old to be the proper gap you maintained above him. There's a lot he communicates in the way his jaw clenches, but none of the answers. Because even in a perfect world, he would still have ran away. The only difference here was that he gave you a heads up before disappearing. And more than that, you were grateful that he ran, because you could wiggle free too, an excuse for slipping out into the night. Coward is the wrong word, but there is no shame about being smart with your moves. And it has been a little freeing, this past year. Your brother drums the seat of the swing as he pushes himself into momentum, thinking about your words. "I'm already fourteen," Yuhui decides. "I need to grow up. Probably west. I want to try some real hamburgers and fries," a small, dismissive laugh. He can make it, he thinks (you know), but something's holding him back, clearly. He hesitates. @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 09:32 PM
“West,” he repeats, because he already knows where Yuhui’s going, where they’re going to end up, working a middling series of minimum-wage jobs designed to obfuscate the reality of his situation—the shitshow operation he’s going to get himself caught up in. “You don’t think he’ll look for us?” Adrian’s not sure how much Yuhui’s gleaned about their father’s dealings, but— —and a part of him, of course, is convinced that there’ll never be a place outside of his father’s reach. The influence isn’t coming from outside anymore. It’s— “—and what would we do?” Adrian’s hands clench into fists. “Just a few more years, and we can apply for college. And then…” And then—what? He’s not sure himself. This part of the script hasn’t been written yet. “If you go,” Adrian says, finally, “I’d understand.” One of them will always take the first move, and it’s never been Adrian. This is what happens: people leave, and Adrian follows. It’s what’s supposed to happen, what needs to happen. If there’s anyone left to resent, it’s himself.
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 09:53 PM
"He'll probably look for us. Like I give a shit." He knows, a little. But like any good fourteen year old, he thinks he can defeat anything that comes his way. There's no harm in trying. And if he's dragged back crying or screaming, or killed because there's no more value in him, or, or... he thinks he can handle it, at least. The steely-eyed resolve has never once left his face. @xianta claus 🎄 adrian | rhys
Adrian Liu (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 10:01 PM
That’s your problem, Adrian doesn’t say. You never give a shit about the things you should. In hindsight, maybe it’s the one thing they have in common. Crap food. Sightseeing. It’s the kind of thing Yuhui’s into. The kind of thing Adrian turns his nose up at. If you just buckle down and get to it… He knows. Yuhui’ll be successful, in a sense. And he’ll be sucked into something greater than he is, biting off more than he can chew. And Adrian will follow, and try to drag him out. His ideal future—he’s never had the luxury to think about it. Maybe he’d be as stubbornly sullen in any reality, in every reality. Maybe there’s something wrong with him, the same thing that’s wrong with his father, the thing he sees in the mirror when he looks too close. Adrian gets up. It’s not real, anyway. It never is. Maybe, in an alternate reality, it went like this. And maybe— Adrian takes the extended hand. Coming from him—it’s more than a concession. More than Yuhui would ever expect.
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 10:11 PM
The surprise shows clearly on his face. He entertained the idea before, of his brother coming along with him from the very beginning instead of chasing after him. But the happiness — the happiness is also written all over Yuhui's face. It fogs his glasses and gives him the brightest smile you've seen since... forever. He tugs you from your seat. You head, shoulder to shoulder, in the opposite direction — deeper into town, where you might find train schedules or bus routes that'll lead from home to an airport, and then much farther, when you're all prepared. Because being by yourself is scary, but knowing you're alone when someone else could've come with you is scarier. Luckily for this Yuhui, he wouldn't ever have to know. But maybe... just maybe... you could make it work. [NO GLORY IN DEATH] ;You won't find glory out there in the west. But for a moment, you'll be happy. You wonder if that'll be enough.

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:00 PM
[THE DARKNESS CLOSES IN AROUND YOU...] ;And takes you for its own. You are no stranger to the powers-that-be manipulating you to their end. And to that end, there is no choice; you simply, dipping under the waves of your consciousness as your left leg burns, right above your ankle. When you wake it's a warm summer day. The crickets sing with promise of a setting sun, rubbing their legs together as you feel the sweltering heat in droves. It's a not-memory but-memory nonetheless; you surely have never been in this situation. But the empathy stirs at you, asks for you to connect. The dusty roads coat your small (small?) palms with red crumbled clay, a little dirty from running through the streets. You're... waiting... for something. Someone runs down the road, heading towards you.

@shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 05-Nov-22 04:15 PM
He remembers. There is some relief in knowing that his memories, already sparse and new, was not taken again. Now. He looks around the area, this was a fabrication created by the anomaly that's potentially causing all this. Was it the strange people in the portraits? whatever Gods that was staring down at them with resentment? ... Was it something else? He bit back the urge to click his tongue, but this situation, to him, was frustrating. There was something about being fed false memories, and being forced to experience all of this by some anomaly. The current best course of action was to continue this farce until he learns more about the situation, and act accordingly to what he's gathered. But the remnants of his frustration from exiting the shrine, followed by once again (again?) being dragged left and right to power he has no control over. What if she pushes this sister to the road? What if he pushed himself to the road? What would happen? The urge to resist and rampage around the spoon that is feeding him lies. But it could be dangerous couldn't it? To fuck it all and fight against the unknown. Not knowing whether you're throwing water or oil to the ravenous flames. Knowing the girl craves an answer though, he smiled, a gentle one like a kind brother. He reaches for the coin in her hands. He can answer, if she'd give him one too. "How about a game then?" The coin in his hand stayed for half a second, before he flipped it upwards, spinning in the air before catching it in the back of his hand. "Heads or Tails? One means we can go to the store." That being tails, The other.. Heads means he'll feed oil to the fire. He doesn't tell her which leads to what though, a precaution to ensure that the anomaly won't bend reality to make him relent. But also a test, he will try to land on a tails, maybe he could be read. He smiles at her, as gentle as a kind brother could be. But he knows what he is, and that was all that mattered for now.

@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 04:46 PM
She pouts, cheeks inflating artificially as she leans back, her hands leaving yours. "Tails." She likes that side. It has a fish on it. Chance is chance is chance, until you skew the odds for yourself. And when you pull your hand away it did reveal tails. Was that an indication that the anomaly knew? Or that the anomaly didn't knew? In a world like this where you could control perception to the tiniest amount, was it so far-fetched to think that it couldn't control the outcome of a single coin? "I hope that's the one that means we're going," she points out, standing up and gripping your head with her small hand, tugging on your dark hair. You suspect if you don't get up she might seriously drag you all the way to the convenience store. "I was going to share my soda with you but you're being stupid about it."

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 05:37 PM
You always had a choice, Ashley. It was between whether it happened to you, or whether it happened to someone else. And in a world where the only thing that exists is 'you', of course your only answer would be the only option. But here, you can't forget — there is someone with you, holding your hand. There is someone with you, following your run with the intent of making you pay for the soda. And there is someone with you, stepping in front of you first, pushing you back on the curb. The crunch is a little sickening. Your stomach does a little funny flip. Have you seen a dead body before? Tons. But have you ever seen a dead body and know that you were the cause of it? Do you even feel guilty? Will this be a cornerstone for the blank notes you call your 'memory'? What else can you lose when you've lost all you could? You're so young. The hand twitches. A crushed butterfly on a wheel. You act before your mind tells you to — something else jerks you unnaturally forth. The truck is blaring, but there's no one in the seat. You grasp the hand and come face to face with yourself. But rather than a caved-in skull, it's a mimicry of a person, charred shadow that has many, many eyes.

2
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 05-Nov-22 05:57 PM
It was a bit of a blur. The sound of the screeching truck, the crunch, being pushed back to the curb. The movement of his body, the grasp towards the hand. The empty truck, the mimicry of a human. The scenery placed before him. He watches them, thinking, maybe he really was more heartless than he thought. The bubbling warmth from a game of catch, the promise of a warm meal, somehow that dissipated slowly, replaced by apathy, and realization of the cruelty of this world. But this felt more familiar, he thinks. He wondered if his jerked movement was his own, or was the cry of panic from the one that caused it all? He watches the charred shadow, its many many eyes trained on him. He stared back, hand still grasped onto the even smaller one. "is this what you wanted to show me?" He asked, to anyone who is willing to answer. "A heartbreak that's etched into your mind? Do you want me to understand? Is that what all this was for?" He asked, the bitterness swallowed down his throat. Hand reaching towards the torn body, where the face once were. "Does it hurt?" It wasn't a harsh grasp, nor was it hostile, it was almost gentle, a slither of sympathy that slipped beneath the cracks. Are you too, a victim of life's many cruelties? @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 06:30 PM
When you open your mouth to speak, it speaks back. Actually, it's more like you can't speak, and what you think you say comes from this monstrosity instead, using your voice. Taking your shape. It somehow forms in front of you. Dripping darkness, all gore and violence, barely learning what a human form might be like as its eyes lid, looking down on you — you again, finally, every shape of you here. The darkness drips against you as it hovers, face so close you can recognize your nose, your lips, your eyes, all under the veneer of black ink. There is no longer any body, and there is no longer any truck, no city, no dusty road, no family to take care of you. Because clearly, even with family given, you would sooner try to kill yourself than try to understand and be happy. You clearly have no memory of your childhood, so why couldn't you just... run? Well, too late for that now. Because you're in a dusty attic strapped to a chair and that thing is in front of you, tipping your chin up with a hand. It raises its chin too, looks down on you. Does it hurt? It asks you. "It hurts not knowing," you feel yourself say. "It hurts not understanding, and having to rebuild myself from the ground up. Was I that bad of a person?"
@shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 05-Nov-22 06:44 PM
there was less shock the more things happen, the more things escalate. He was learning, understanding the nature of this anomalous dream. Using whatever you had and twisting it all together. The attic, being strapped down on a chair. It felt familiar somehow, but he was sure it shouldn't. Really, it was frustrating, to feel like you should know but you don't, to feel everything weighing on the tip of your tongue, but no answers come to mind. Familiar yet Foreign. A feeling he was growing used to to his dismay. He hated it. His shadow looms in front of him, taking his shape, using his voice. His own spoke back, but he didn't let himself speak, he didn't try or want to. It just spoke. A frustration that grew more by the second. He bit his own tongue, trying to do what he could to retain what control he had left. He didn't want to hear an answer that didn't come from him, that wasn't spoken by his own choice. Right or wrong, truth or lie. If it was voiced, it would solidify its existence afterall, and to feel some thing was making him spill it all? ... He hated it. "What do you want?" He tries to ask, if he is able. What does any of them want? What did he, who had nothing, can give to you? Answer. Answer him. Answer him. He struggles against the straps, a barely restrained circus animal, trapped against its will for a show. He'll tear the audience apart if he needs to. He Hated It. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 07:15 PM
Was it something? Someone? If no one drew attention to how different you were, the line drawn in between the individual and the mass of people in a room, would you even know? How many people comprised of the individual that calls themselves 'Ashley Walker'? What do you want? It asks you. You feel your words being stolen, puppeteered by the thing in front of you. It cocks its head inquisitively, overlaying a hand on yours, and with horror you watch as it sinks into you, turning your skin the same inky darkness as it possessed. The patterns that overlay it are clear; the same inscription, over and over, binding you to this. Blood floods your mouth. When you speak its incomprehensible. It hurts, but not as much as it would hurt if it took over you and used your mouth to speak words, took away your chance at becoming someone or something. Despite that, you know what you he it means to speak. I want to know who I am where I was who loved me who held my hand who would take care of me why I can't remember— Ashley Walker leans back, stumbling. It has your face, which your own currently disappears under a goo of gore, and your skin, stretched perfectly to contain it. If that was something like you, did that mean what was outside was simply turned in? He grips his face with a hand, scared, but beneath that grip was a wondrous smile, too big and too wide. "If you don't want this life, do you mind if I take it instead?"
OPTIONAL: ROLL STR.
@shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 05-Nov-22 07:47 PM
The thought that races in his mind, the roll of film that flowed in his head, whatever or whoever he was before, his film has been cut and burned, the rest was blank, having yet been filled. The new experiences the people he's met, the emotions he's felt.
The Warmth as a father offered him a home. The Tickling sensation of a senior coworker ruffling his head as she teased him. The Smell of a Warm Bowl of Ramen as another treated him to lunch.
New experiences, new memories, one he's made, one he's still making. [I want to know who i am where i was who loved me who held my hand who would take care of me why can't I remember] He couldn't remember. He never will. Whose hand held his, if he was loved, if he had a home or a family. He struggles against the straps, wilder, angrier. He can't remember. A frustration a curiosity, but one that he's accepted. He cannot remember. But what was old memories forgotten compared to a new life lived? He could still make memories, still find people, and maybe here, maybe now he could have found it. A hand, A home. One that was real, and one he won't forget. The straps loosened in his struggles. [If you don't want this life, do you mind if I take it instead?] Like a rampaging animal fighting against captivity. His mind continues to tick.
The Relief of helping hands that held his towers of coffee The Laughter shared between two people lost in the city The Frustration of a nuisance that followed him everywhere, yet one he doesn't truly pry off.
A life barely lived. The question was met in a sea of red, anger that has been held under control for much too long. He breaks out of his chair.
19:48
Staring at the foreign entity that stole his face. Though anger uncontrolled, his voice was calm still, but instead of a jovial politeness, it was a chilling demand. "Stop Talking." He tries to grab his shadow, a mirror of what was supposed to be him, and attack. However flimsy, however weak, however easily he will lose. He will try. He'll always try. STR NAT 1
2
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 08:18 PM
Ashley Walker barely fights against the monster's hold. He bucks and thrashes but it's weak, a dimmer flame. His fingers try to cut into you, all the goo, but it just gives away to the mess of incantations that crawl up his arm, return him back to the way things were supposed to be. The monster roars — 'stop talking.' He winces as the goo meets his face and peels off in a black film that webs across his human face, wincing as he shudders from the touch of reprehensible contact. He tries to fight you too but only ever has enough strength as you have. It wants you. It wants all of you — it wants your life, your dreams, your hopes. It's been growing ravenous because it no longer has any food to take, and has to look for something else to sustain. Stupid humans. Stupid, foolish, brave, disgusting humans. Why can't you roll over and die like what prey is meant to be? Why do you have to fight so hard to cling for a life that can never be yours? Aren't you concerned of who you were before, [ ]? (It took your name, too.) What happens if you meet someone that knew you and the only you that they remember is some harsh, terrible thing? Wouldn't be better to roll over and die? It bites, you bite. It feeds, you feed. It tries to kill, but you strike first. Because nothing is more dangerous than an animal backed into a corner, fighting for the last few things it has — its life. But it has always ever been you. And every strike against yours might tear you from the inside, but at the end, when your consciousness dims and you feel the blood drip from your face unto something that used to be you, the incantation struggling to stay bruised upon your calf, you know. You've won. And there is no glory in death, but there is victory. [NO GLORY IN DEATH] ;I'll take it when the crown is given to me.
FINISHED! THANK U, TOMORROW WILL BE THE ENDING @shelfenstein 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

🌾 TO GUIDE OR BE GUIDED / caiguang
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:23 PM
The last thing you remember are the leaves against the late afternoon sky, the concerned faces the strangers (friends?) you had met earlier, and the blood streaked faces of your companions. The last thing you expect is to wake up in a classroom. A hazy afternoon, with rays of the afternoon sun streaming in from the large windows. A blackboard against the wall, filled with scrawling sentences and minor equations... simple concepts... middle school? High school even? You could take a seat if you wanted, or even sit at the teacher's desk to play pretend... or reminisce. Either is fine really. The room is empty, save for one individual who seems to be sleeping in the back corner, sunlight barely missing their face. @gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg
Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:13 PM
An empty classroom. Caiguang reaches for his phone to check his reflection. To say his mind hadn't wandered to the idea of revisiting school before would be a lie. Sometimes he would pass by one on his way home -- Just around the dot where the final bell would ring, and students would rush to their freedom. The images in Meteor City invoke a different picture than the buildings he was familiar with, yet the tinge of nostalgia remained. He didn't miss school, not in essence. He did miss something around that period in his life though, so missing school was akin to placing himself near his actual object of longing. He allows himself to absorb the familiarity -- this experience -- of a large-windowed classroom with a blackboard. Midday, easy questions... Caiguang wanders towards the back of the room, where the sleeping individual sits. That used to be his spot, back in the day at the height of his middle school angst. Haha. "Hey, where are the others?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 05:24 PM
You look younger in your reflection... just like when you were a student... back when you still hung out with ------ --. But that's a story for another time, isn't it. Right now the person in front of you raises her head, albeit sleepily, blinking once, then twice before staring at you with wine-red eyes. "Um..... are you done? Everyone was already gone and you said someone wanted to tell you s'mthing and..." She yawns before ending her sentence. Leaning back and stretching her arms before shaking her self awake. Blearily, she rubs at her eyes, before turning back towards you. "How was the confession? Or did they mean to give it to me instead?" She leans forward with a snarky grin, rummaging within the desk before bringing out several envelopes with heart-shaped stickers stuck on them. "Even if we have the same face... I always beat you in love right?" (edited)

Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:40 PM
"Hmn..." Caiguang tilts his head back, allowing the rest of his weight onto the one desk in front of the girl's. "How was the confession indeed...?" With the way this scene was playing out, he supposes -- like theater, he was playing a role, a part, someone else's story. So who is he playing then? Nobody gave him the memo there -- Just some loose context clues to adlib from. A conversation of immediate familiarity, and the 'same' face. He assumes the two are something along the lines of siblings, maybe twins. He rummages a hand in his pocket, in an attempt to find something: an envelope, some lost memory... something leftover from this so-called confession. In the meantime, he reminds himself he's back in middle school. Talking to a twin, or sibling. "Psh, can you say that you've actually beaten me in love? Quantity doesn't equal quality. Besides, we both know guys only care about the face. Girls are complicated. I don't get 'em at aaaaaaaaaaaall..." @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 05:53 PM
There's no love letter or confession in your pocket... because you are just an actor in a play. An actor assigned to a role with no lines, no props, and not a single thing to go off of.... other than the individual in front of you. She smiles smugly at your statement, before quickly flipping two of the three envelopes in front of her. Suzy and Elennor. Are both scrawled onto the envelopes. "And that, my dear brother, is why I am winning." At this point she finally gets up, the chair making a slow creaking noise as its feet drag against the classroom floor. She walks around to the table, slinging her arm around your neck. A motion signifying friendship... was it familiar to you? It sure felt that way. "It's okay... I know that without me, you'd be incapable of showing other people..." she pauses for dramatic effect. "... love. In fact. I bet people will fall in love with you but you won't even be able to reciprocate..." She sighs before stifling a yawn. Afternoon drowsiness sure got to her. "Wanna carry me home? I'm sleeeeeepy." @gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg
Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:12 PM
Suzy and Elennor. He catches sight of two names, before immediately turning his head away. "Nope. Nope. Those letters can't stop me if I can't read." A weight pulls him closer towards her. An arm around his neck: That gesture was familiar, on his own terms. His experiences are not inherently unique -- the smells, the feelings, the experiences. Somewhere in between, everyone has had their first confession. Their first time in school, such and such, things like that. His childhood friend used to do this gesture, too. But in this role, the actress in place was... so-and-so's sister. "Oh I see how it is. Mister 'doesn't know anything about love' can't reciprocate people's feelings, but can carry his sister home. Make it make sense. Since you're a master of looove, I'm sure you can carry yourself home. Let's remember who had a chance to nap, and who hadn't." He points at her and then at himself, before leaning his weight into her. "Ahhh, I'm sooo tired..." @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 06:20 PM
"Huhhh? You're gonna ignore it? Just like that? Boo..." She sighs before leaning her head on his shoulder, a clingy, sticky motion that was making it clear that she wasn't willing to let go. Your childhood friend stuck onto you like this as well. A companion, someone to lean on, someone you could trust with every fiber of your being... "Okay I'm sorry, sorry okay? I was napping while waiting for you. Gimme a break...." Tch. Looks like acting cute wouldn't cut it for today, so she'll drop the topic... for now. "Do you wanna head home right away? Or do you want to stop by the court?" She jerks her head towards the direction of the field. "Some people were playing a game or two. They probably need a fill since our school's so small." @gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg
Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:37 PM
"Haha, didn't you already get your break?" He presses his index finger against her forehead. "Said so yourself, allll in the same breath. You were napping and you still want a break?" His smile widens, an expression of mischief mixed with amusement. It's childish banter. He doesn't hate it. Not that he had a list of hates to begin with. So perhaps the better way to phrase it was that he enjoyed it. "I stopped playing," Caiguang responds, as soon as the familiar question is proposed. It was a knee-jerk response that was all his, and his alone. He, Caiguang, didn't play anymore. The role he was meant to wear? He's not sure, but what was said had already been said. "...you know that." The second sentence drifts into inaudible silence, a sign of uncertainty. He's willing the scenario to play that way, where he, the role, also no longer played on the court. "...Lets head home. Didn't you say you were tired?" @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 06:46 PM
She nods. "Uhuh... yeah." Though to what exactly she's agreeing with, you can't be too sure. You make your way through the silent hall... most of the other students have already gone home at this point, and you can't help but feel the nostalgic pang in your heart as you roam through the school to the exit... Whenever would you get another chance to be in this situation... Did you even want to in the first place? Or do you prefer to just watch from a distance, to revel in the memories you enjoy... but just as quickly cast them aside as soon as the pain of your past starts to nip at your heels... Unfortunately, you're the main actor in this play. You feel the slight tug at the hem of your shirt, from the person standing beside you. "Why did you stop?" It's an innocent question. @gale (xmas flavored)🐋| ll🐸🦄cg
Caiguang Ma (HE/she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:15 PM
A pang of hurt pinches at his heart, in the same moment that he feels a tug against his shirt. He's written essays upon essays in his head, all on this very topic. How easy it was to rationalize his emotions into inaction. How any person giving advice would look at his problems and tell him: Isn't the solution right before you? Why won't you take it? Even he would have given that advice, if not knowing he was the recipient. It's much easier to help when he was the helper, not the helped. Of course he wants to be here. He wants to pause time and pretend things were back to simple. At least here, he found something to feel. There, outside, reality -- reality was numbing. No pain, no happiness, nothing. He wants to be here to remember what it was like to simply be. Alas, the past also had its own troubles. It had been years, to the point where he'd long forgotten what it felt to bury hurt down his throat until he suffocated. The grass is always greener on the other side, they say. "Good question..." The real reason he stopped no longer bothered him -- Not in the way it did when it was a fresh cut wound. Time, in a decade, healed that wound into an unforgiving scar. And so the pain subsided, leaving behind a scab waiting to be itched. That itch was residual regret. "...doesn't it always start and end with the same thing?" He turns towards the girl -- his sister -- and smiles. "It's always about love." @dodo | luka
1
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 07:41 PM
Time heals all wounds only as so long it gets enough time to rest. To recover. To poke and prod at it with iron hot sticks would only make it fester, become infected, rot away from inside the core until you decide to rip the entire heart out.... Luckily you weren't at that point. Instead she nods at his statement, tearing her gaze away to stare out the windows they passed by. In the end... it really was always about love. "Do you want to take a detour-- well.... shortcut. I heard this is a trick the seniors use." Her head turns away from the window, and towards the next door they passed by. With her hands reaching for the doorknob, she twists it before jerking the door open for Caiguang to look inside. To her, it looks like just another hallway. To you... it's another time, another space. Are you familiar with the tricks anomalies play? You may not have many things that you hate, but you sure do have many things you regret... But what if you had the opportunity to do it over? Inside is another hallway... this one much more familiar to you. You feel a slight tingling on your arm... where you felt the burning of the inscriptions mark your skin. No pain as much as you felt earlier... if you still remembered it. But the hallway... you recognized it as the very first time you moved to China, the very day that you transferred schools. You didn't meet him yet... but you could go back to a time where you could meet him again. There's a couple of familiar faces... though they weren't so familiar at the time. They glance back your one, once or twice curious as to who these strangers were peeking through the door. Your sister peers inside before turning to you with a smile on her face. In her usual rambunctious nature, she would have immediately kicked you inside... but maybe your words today had an impact on her. So the choice is up to you. Choices have consequences.

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 08:27 PM

It was a golden opportunity for you to relive your life once more... this time avoiding the regrets that seemed to haunt you so badly... or at least, an opportunity to prepare for them if things went awry instead. Maybe this time you'll be able to say clearly what you felt, or wanted. Maybe this time you'll manage resolve the relationship you had left dragging, to nurture it so it could grow.. or nip it in the bud before anything could start in the first place. Maybe you'll learn to feel... happiness, to break away from the apathy that clings to your every action. To feel without without contemplating what it is you ought to feel. There are a lot of things coursing through your head... but for now you can bask in the afternoon light in your tour of the school. LQCC - eunji

🌾 TO GUIDE OR BE GUIDED / eunji
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:14 PM
The last thing you see before your eyes close, are the apologetic gaze of someone who wants to help you... but can't. Are you upset? It's easy to blame everything else around you for things that happen. Why didn't they tell us more. Why couldn't they warn us. Why did no one help. But have you thought about their perspective? What could they have possibly done to help you? In any case, it's too late for that now, as the grains of dirt dig under your nails and your eyes slowly fall shut. It's not the embrace of death that wraps around you, (you've experienced it before, so you know you still breathe, still feel). It's the rustling of a heavy quilt, one that brings warmth to your chilled body. Comfort in the littlest of things: a heated room, warm sheets, a large bed... it's easy enough to fall asleep where you are, to continue keeping your eyes shut for as long as you want, until you feel ready enough to wake. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 02:47 PM
Weariness and the last wisps of fear leave her wanting, questioning, gasping for breath. It's easy to blame everything else around you, as easy as it is to blame yourself. But she's tired, and she wants someone else to take the blame, to bear its burden, to suffer from her grievances. She wants to point at something substantial, and think this is why the world is the way it is, not to accept its cruelties at facevalue. She wants to blame someone, and there is nothing else tangible but Suu to blame. A belated slew of anger and frustration and terror bubble out from her chest and eek out past her lips in broken, shattered phrases, hollowed out by a sickening vitriol that burns darker than the ink that no longer mars her skin, leaving in its wake a sludgy mass of emotion she knows not how to name. And in that revolting slop, she finds warmth, seeping through flesh, reaching bone, which also dissolve, like liquid gold, in its honeyed embrace. It's heavy, and its comforting, and... and. Eunji breathes in, slowly, through her nose, rooting out subtle notes of incense and smoke. She's not sure how long she lies there, just breathing, resting. It feels like an eternity, but when her eyes open, it feels like it's not even been a minute. Habitually, she finds herself rubbing at the corners as she rises, slow, not quite seeing, still in the process of waking. Had she slept at all? But it doesn't take her long to realize what had just happened, moments before. (Moments?) What are her surroundings like...? Are they familiar? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:57 PM
There's nothing familiar about the wallpaper hastily pasted on the wall, or the handwoven stiches on the quilt that lay on top of you. The window creaks with a low whine, like a stranger asking for entry... yet all the same you find comfort in your surroundings. There's nothing uncomfortable in the unfamiliar familiarity of your surroundings... How silly. The room is well lived in. A mattress that creaks from use when you turn, a pillow not meant for your head-- but one you rest comfortably on top of. You are a guest in the house... but it asks for you to call it home. A scent lingers in the air, no longer is it the sticky sweetness laced with the rot that threatened to choke you out before... but one that you've lived with much longer... A hearty... soy? Of all things? It seems to be coming from outside the room. A comforting, warming scent. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:25 PM
Tales of homes away from home and beds too big and blankets too small filter in one ear and stumble out the other, bereft of all comfort to be gleaned from such stories. Absorbed by her quiet contemplation as she looks, and looks, and looks, for something wrong. But all that lies in her path is ease and warmth. And that is where she finds her discomfort. Could it really be so easy? Eunji is hesitant. Is she still dressed the same? Grime, cheap polyester, and exhaustion? When she peels the blanket back, the cool air that hits her makes her grimace. She'd always been an early riser, but something calls her back, tells her to rest her eyes some more. She wants to. She wants to. This isn't real, though. She's been through enough anomalies to know this to be true, of all the things here... but she does doubt that, too. If it was familiar, it would be that much easier to dismiss as fake. It isn't, though. Famliar. But it's a home that calls to her nonetheless, and isn't that what she wanted? Muddled senses struggle to grasp onto something, some train of thought more valuable than her stream of consciousness. She finds it, languid though her mind is to hold onto it with the firmness she desires. Getting to her feet, Eunji walks towards the door. Is it open? The doorknob creaks when she twists it— though when she tries again, her grip too feeble the first time, the mechanism snapping back into place, it is silent, and smooth. What lies beyond? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 03:39 PM
Cozy pajamas that don't belong to you... but fit like a glove nonetheless. Well worn and smelled of fresh laundry. The question that should be asked instead is... do you feel rejuvenated? As you hesitate to open the door, you can hear the thudding of footsteps outside the room, each impact against the floorboard becoming louder, and louder still as it reaches your location. Before you could move your arm away, the door slams open, disregarding the person standing behind... In this case, you. And without another word, as you clutch your forehead where the door had just hit... comes another impact along with a string of words. "Get out of bed alread--oof." You stumble and fall backwards, body unable to withstand the weight of two children (children? not adults?) colliding into each other. Luckily, what awaits you is not a cold hard-wood floor, but a plush rug that had been set beside your bed. (Your bed?) You lay on your back, eyes staring into the ceiling as your gaze burns into the lightbulb that flickered on in the ceiling, feeling the weight of another body on top of your own until they roll off to the side, clutching their forehead with much, much dramatism. Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:52 PM
...Is it still.. her body that she's in? Her eyes search for a mirror, or really, any reflective surface, before she's bowled over, suddenly and spectacularly, biting back a yelp— The impact burns, as the flesh does, a cold, sizzling feeling that then echoes throughout, releasing pain from the point of where head had hit wood in all too steady waves. Eunji remains speechless, if anything growing more confounded with each passing second, as one child, no, two, crash into each other. The padded meat of her hands catch the brunt of the damage this time, but it sill sends shockwaves of pain lacing up her arms, curling around her shoulders, tensed with the sudden onslaught of new information. The thoughts that enter her mind are foreign, but warm, and she hasn't the heart to refuse them for the first couple moments. She accepts the actions she's told to do— that this body, or soul tells her to do. Then, the noise starts up again, and Eunji frowns. "Be quiet," she utters, trying to clamp a hand over the screaming mouth. It comes out harsher than she intends it to. Not a mother. A sibling? An older sister, perhaps? She sits up again. Mirror. Who is she? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 04:04 PM
You are Eunji Lim. Dark brown hair, white bangs. Two moles, one under each eye... Or however else you looked as a child. You are a detective, brought onto a case to discover... discover something... find someone... save people. You have a job, you're a researcher, an inquisitive mind. How else do you want to put labels on Eunji Lim? You are-- "Min-ah you. Are. Soooooooo. MEAN. Aigo aiya ya ya ya." With a muffled voice, she spits out complaint after complaint, no end in sight. She kicked at you with each word, but it does little harm to you really, as she has no intention to cause any real harm. "I'm so cute... how can you be so mean." She rolls her eyes from the padded floor, but you can hardly see it from underneath her hands on her forehead. She drags her tongue over your hand. Absolutely. Disgusting by the way.... but who's she to care about matters in the face of things that are more important? So she slobbers all over your hand in an attempt to get you off her, before making a disgusted face... as if you weren't the one with saliva all over your hand now. "Maybe when we grow up I'll be the cute hottie and you'll be ugly because you're so mean." @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:15 PM
A sibling, she deduces. She doesn't want to think, really, about who Eunji Lim is. She's thought about it too much, as of late, and still, that's too little. Rather.... Min-ah? ...... Min-ah. Fine. If that's what this anomaly wanted, then so she would live as Min-ah, if only for a few scant moments. She'd live in her skin, inhabit her memory... just for a time. With each kick, she imagines what this might've been like. To live like this. The wet appendage is disgusting, no doubt, and she peels her hand away from the girl's mouth with a grimace that she makes no attempt to disguise, nor make pleasant, hastily wiping her hand on the younger child's forearm. "Ugly?" she mutters, still looking around for... some sort of clue. Her body is one she recognizes, but none of this dialogue is correct. This family isn't hers. Eunji— Min-ah?— gets to her feet, and inspects her surroundings a second time. For clues, as an investigator does. But she does try to act as if it's familiar. .... But nothing is familiar. She was an only child. She had no siblings. What of the other child? She's the other one. Oh. Eunji looks at her hands, less slobbery now. How young is she, right now? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 04:34 PM

The other girl finally sits up, a frown evident on her face now that her tactics were falling upon deaf ears. Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:41 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 04:49 PM

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:57 PM
"I'm not calling you noona," she retorts flatly, cocking an unimpressed brow. She falls silent, letting the other girl take the lead, as she thought to herself about how best to approach the situation at hand. But it was difficult. The aroma is tantalizing, this she cannot deny, and be it a real sense of hunger or something other, nostalgia fires up her senses with a sharp, keen wanting for the salty sweet broth and the crunchy texture of pah in between the softer, chewier bites of the ramyeon. dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 05:06 PM

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:14 PM

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:28 PM

Home is dead. Home is far, and home is stuck. Home is gone, at this point. Home is not here, though, and she's too tired to build another. But she's not having fun anymore. She doesn't want to humor this anymore. She wants answers— she needs them. Home doesn't matter. Just bring her back.

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:09 PM
Sliding the shoes on, she regards the porch, the street, the winter with the same apprehension she can't help but feel. That she hasn't stopped feeling, since walking a million steps in the snow. Wanting to die, but wanting to live, but wanting to give in all the same. Yes, she remembers. Always behaving like a fool. Trusting, despite not. Spoonfed the rotting meat of a friend, believing what they say when they say, "it's good for you," and swallowing, feeling the leech scrape against the walls of your throat and begin its steady consumption of you, and everything you once considered to be you. Why couldn't she see past it? Hours mistaken for days. Dying of thirst? Starvation? It wasn't so long a time at all, but she'd felt it. It had been so real to her. At some point, amidst those thousands, hundred thousands, the first million, she'd ceased to feel so driven, step after plodding step. A vitriolic bitterness had coated her tongue, similar to the one that sinks its barren teeth into the flesh of her shoulders now, rigid as they are in their immutable fury. At some point, she'd thought that the anomaly, the world itself, found joy in their derisions of her soul, her body, her mind. Should she crumble further? What if she collapses in on herself completely? The flesh, carved into, dug out, made hollow, made to hold— filled with ink, then emptied of it. No use as a cartridge, nor the brush. No longer the artist, either. A pawn? She had no use there, too, and she never was the knight, no more so than she was the queen, the king— the player. If it did, were they watching here here too? Would she finally exist in a world without their voyeuristic gaze? Beyond their reach? She steps forward, and calls, "Subin, where are you?" Eunji thinks she's dead. But Eunji also wants to believe she isn't. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 07:25 PM
You have... suffered so much at the hands of life itself. Each day you reach out, only to grasp at the straws of everything that tries to pass you by, to leave you alone, to leave you so that there is nothing left for you to call your own. Home to you... is dead and gone. Home is far away, home is out of reach, home is... wherever they are... but if they no longer exist... where else do you have to go? You can take a look out to the desolate winter... but there's no one who responds to your calls. There's another light in the distance... Not too far off... maybe one hundred steps? It's a small amount compared to what you've done before... But are you willing to take the leap? It's comfortable enough here. A bowl of ramen with your (was it really yours), name on it... a bed that was warm enough to sleep in if you so wished to do so... but this wasn't home to you. The warmth here couldn't scratch at the frigid loneliness that ate away at your heart. The light seems closer now... As if it's coming to you if you are too afraid to walk to it. The cold is a scary thing after all, it eats away at your core, to the point where you're unable to move any longer once your limbs are numb and frozen... But this light seems warmer to you... You can hear familiar voices, and smell familiar scents. Not this pseudo-familiarity that came with Subin's house... but something that was just like... just like.... You know that anomalies can show you dreams you want to see. Do you have a little hope in your heart that what you want to see will show up? The light is closer now. Ten steps, that's all it takes for you to reach forward and grab the doorknob... your doorknob. You can see the plate on the door. Apartment 963. @st. namulas 🃏 eunji

Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:40 PM
Do you think she wants to see this? One hundred steps becomes ten, becomes nine, becomes eight, seven, six... Seven. Six. Eight. Ten. Twelve. The stairs are harder to walk up this time. Her feet feel heavier than they ever have before. A million steps feels like nothing, now. Fifteen. Thirteen. She stumbles, she falls. It's closer. Twenty one. Thirty. The ramen is cold. She isn't hungry anymore. She wants to throw up. She swallows it down. Fuck this. Fuck this. This isn't worth it. This isn't worth it. This can't be worth it. She reaches the room. She opens the door. Her footsteps leave dirt and grime in their wake. She hadn't even taken her shoes off. She crawls the through the window. She steps out into the crisp night air again. She finds her way onto the roof. And she lies back, breathing hard. Harder than she'd expected, climbing onto the roof. Finding purchase on tile. It digs into her back uncomfortably, at odd angles. She feels like she's being stabbed. She wishes that they'd commit. She stares at the sky, and the endless expanse above. Lights blinking in and out, with nothing but her own faulty perception to blame. Her eyes are dry, and her body feels cold. She sucks in cold air through her teeth, letting it seep into her skin, her muscle, her sinews and the fat too, and then the bone. The nerves follow, and smaller units after. And she wishes she could die here, staring into the night, as fake as it is. "No," she murmurs, and it is so faint, so soft an utterance that someone else might've said it entirely. Subin? No, she's gone. The wind. Her lids are heavy. Her eyes shut. Her voice dies in her throat. She doesn't want to go in there. She doesn't want the anomaly to make a mockery of the dead. Of them. Of her parent. Of her family. She wants, if anything, to preserve what she has of them, even if it is just memory. Please, don't take that away too. @dodo | luka (edited)

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 08:06 PM
Doesn't it hurt to remember? You don't want to see them, even an image of them. But remembering them puts you in pain all the same. Would it be easier to forget? To replace the memory with something that hurt less. Isn't it okay if something isn't real, as long as it didn't cause you pain? Doctors prescribe medication to their patients, so that they can accept foreign substances in their bodies to help acclimate them to the issues they have on hand. It's the same method, just reworked a little differently. If you want you can replace what hurts you most. The gunshot, the broken parting, torn away before you could add in any last words. Don't worry, it's not removing any fond memories, that would be awful... rather.. think of it as a restructuring of the ending that made the process so painful. The last words you wanted to say... and the last words you wanted to hear... The passing of seasons and the passing of family was never easy... To be taken without being able to add in another word was even worse... The goal was never to make you feel hurt. The goal was never to inflict pain. The goal is not to have you laying on the cold rooftop alone with the cold air biting at your cheeks and seeping into your bones. It's a chance to give you last words. You want it? Choices have consequences @st. namulas 🃏 eunji
Eunji Lim (she/her) BOT 05-Nov-22 08:53 PM
Doesn't it hurt more to forget? Knowing something's missing, but not knowing what? Those that have forgotten have gone mad trying to remember. Shed tears, sleep, sanity. Given in to misery, to death, to an eternity of knowing not what they ought to know? Is it okay if something is fake, when knowing brought you so much joy? Doctors prescribe medication to their patients so that they can acclimate to their problems. But it's not the same. It wouldn't be the same. Do you rip off a limb when it grows tired? Do you sever your arm when your hand begins to ache? What pale imitations of her family could this anomaly give her? She couldn't deny her curiosity, her interest— but from a scientific point of view. Months ago, Eunji Lim would've ran the hundred steps, made it in thirty. She would've critiqued their examinations of her mind, her perception, found them lacking. She would've laughed with them, eaten with them, confided in them— as she always did. She can't imagine doing so now. Aubade had said something similar, she thinks. On the beach. It feels far away, now. Her frenzied attempt at murder— that is what it was, yes— brought on by a taunting that had set her aflame. She wonders where that flame, everburning is now, in the face of this door, this taunting. Dwindling, as she is? Sputtering? The ashes still smoulder with a wanting to burn brighter, faster, harder. To fill up that dark and empty cavern with light, bring into her heart and mind some modicum of warmth. Months ago.... No. A year. She'd chosen to serve herself up on the finest of platters. Her mind had been granted the sweetest reprieve of the heavy burden of having to live, think, and breathe. But even then, she'd faltered before her family. Why? Maybe she wanted to be loved too. Maybe she hadn't been. But Eunji Lim was.
20:53
She needed no last words to impart on. She doesn't have any ready. She could have an eternity, maybe two.. three, four, six eternities... and she still wouldn't be able to find the right words to say to Feu. Feu had already said their goodbyes, like they'd known this was coming. They'd had it ready. Written in a letter, prepped for her viewing pleasure. Feu didn't need to listen to her prattle on. She didn't want to ask them to do that for her. Not the real Feu, nor some fake. They'd done enough. The hurt is unintentional. But it hurts all the same, and this, she doesn't want to forget either. Hurt... Though her chest aches, her cheeks stinging, her eyes burning, she doesn't want to forget the hurt. She doesn't want to forget this misery, this hate, this bitterness. She doesn't want to forget this despair. Isn't the fact that she feels it still— feels it so deeply— proof that she loved? and serve as proof that she was loved? In the face of loss, she'd read that you're forced to grow around it. That that hole never grows any smaller. That the impact of that loss does not scar, nor heal, nor diminish. That it mars your very being forever, for as long as memory will allow. Tears prick the corners of her eyes. Before leaving for Russia, before heeding Andreyev's call, Eunji had said to Feu, a bit awkwardly, wanting to joke in the face of past traumas, (unwilling to unpack them under the weight of their heavy, cool gaze just yet)— "I'll get you the tea that you liked. Char-free." And then she'd closed the door. That's enough. It's human to hurt. And it's fine, now. It truly is fine, now. To hurt. And to be human.
20:53
Eunji sits up. Eunji turns away from the door, and cups her hands together. Her thumb draws the smallest of humanoid figures on the surface of her palm, slow in her ministrations. Sluggish. Heavy. Her fists close around it, and she brings that fist to her forehead. Her shoulders shudder with every sob, wracked with pain, with hurt, with guilt. Her breath eeks out of her in shivering breaths, the cold reaching in deep. Her fingers are cold from where they wrap around her arms, like Feu's, and she admits, again, to herself, the safety in being human, the comfort in feeling so deeply, and the warmth that she once felt, sharing meals with her family. When the crying stops— and it's a long while, before it does, Eunji croaks to the anomaly, to the audience, to her only chance, "... no, I don't think I do." @dodo | luka
6
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 09:23 PM
It hurts so much to remember when time has not passed, wounds have not healed, and injuries lay raw and aching. All it wants to do is help ease the pain... because how much could it hurt if you really just didn't know... What was so bad about offering a solution... if only it was a temporary one. But your choices are yours, made with your decision and your rational. Here, there is no choice but to respect those choices that you make. It will not force you to walk the steps, it will not make you brave the cold, but these are all decisions that you have made. So the wind bites at your cheeks, and the frost starts to fall. Do you hate it? The cold winter melody that plays in tune as the icicles shimmer and clink as they fall to the pavement? The cold that nips at your cheeks until you enter a warm room and find a steaming mug of tea for you to sip from? The memories that you want to hold dear, the memories that create that pang of longing reside in your chest... but they keep you warm during the night. When you choose to remember pain, you also choose to remember warmth. To revel in the delight that is the dance and song of the wind outside, as you seat yourself in the worn armchair, mug of steaming hot tea on top of a cute little coaster hand knit from an acquaintance you met a few days ago. The gentle croaks from Han, whose feathers shine and glow from preening and... And there they are, not in this false mimicry of the anomaly showing you what it thought you wanted, but the real memory that you lived. Your family, huddled together in a small apartment as the wind dances outside. You've built a home already Eunji, that home resides within your heart. Wherever you go, home follows... as long as you wish to remember.
21:23
Your family doesn't need a location to tie itself down, nor do you need to hold your family in one location. Your memories that you hold sting and burn as you remember your regrets, and remember the mistakes you wish you never met... but they sit alongside the warmth of the past, there are far too many other memories that you have for it to drown it out. You already remember your last words fondly. They would too. The pain makes you human. The pain reminds you of what you have experienced. The highs, the lows, and everything in between. Mundane moments that mean nothing are so precious... it takes some time before you can unwrap the boxes. But for now... Your body is wracked with the cold... it's a familiar feeling at this point. The cold, the loneliness, the only sound aside from your tear streaked sobs being the howling of the wind. The frost begins to settle on you... One snowflake, then another. They melt at first, but they settle over you as you turn away from the door, any possibility of warmth... But you have your own warmth in you right now. You hold tight to the memories as you feel your limbs turn numb... but strangely enough your fists are the last to go. The cold spreads from your toes, the top of your head, your elbows... Almost as if you're being encased in the ice itself... It hurts, physically, you feel the pinpricks of the ice against your skin as the cold etches itself deep into your bones. The inscriptions from your heart seem to eat at you from the inside out, a feeling of ice that permeates from within your core, spreading outwards to meet the chill breeze that froze from the outside in. But don't worry. You know you won't freeze over.
21:24
[ NO GLORY IN SACRIFICE ] ;You hold tight to everything you hold dear, there is no sacrifice when the price isn't worth the result.
21:24

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 12:16 PM
The darkness soon settles around you, a warm and enveloping embrace as you sink deeper into the cloying scent that tries to imbue itself into your body. But slowly it fades away with the passage of time... or maybe you were just adjusting to it instead? The human body is capable of miraculous deeds, able to go beyond their limitations when under stressors. It's easy to run away, and easier still to ignore everything going on, but when faced with no choice but to continue on... all you can do is endure. The pain in your eye seems to ebb, no more than a dull ache that acts as a reminder of the events that had occurred before. Breathe in, breathe out. The light is shining once more. The warm rays of sunshine, the chirping of the birds, the rustling of the leaves in the ease of the afternoon breeze. It felt like summertime. You briefly remember that it was November, but right now... it certainly didn't feel that way. You're back in the village it seems. Maybe you had been brought out here... but with the sun this high in the air-- did that mean you spent the night out? dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 12:51 PM
Any decent detective would be tempted... but what would that make you? Regardless, for now you turn heel and find yourself faced with a path unfamiliar to you. With no recollection of walking this road before, all that's left of you is to continue on the path forward... or technically in this case, backward. There's a difficulty in trying to focus, not a result of any pain, but an eerie blurriness that attempts to descend upon you as you continue moving away, like a deep haze that seems to settle around the area as you continue to walk further away from the only building in sight. The warm daylight that trickled between the leaves on the trees start to fade, as afternoon turns into evening, and evening turns to night. The fog is settling, and you feel the cool mist latch itself onto you-- yet there wasn't any discomfort associated with it. It was a cool brisk breeze, one that called you home. One that would surely fade away as you dried yourself in the warmth of a home. You're about to reach the main road. Where do you want to go? @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 01:15 PM
Was he still too disoriented to walk around, after all? Or maybe he's still under the village's influence? There's no reason to let him go so easily...even if by some chance he was found unsuitable for those "rites" of theirs, they wouldn't risk him going to the authorities. Nothing makes sense. Not when day turned to night in a blink of an eye and his mind continues to spin, the only thing he can do is to keep going. One of the first lessons that his mom taught him was to survive, no matter what. And he owes her at least that much, there's no way he'll die before her. It's a type of grief that no parent should ever have to experience. He rubs his temples as he reached the fork in the road. Think. The path he takes could very well determine if he lives or dies...maybe he's overthinking this. But as a man who had been sheltered by love for most of his life, danger is hardly something that he's familiar with. He should find the car. Luka should still be in the village's entrance, right? @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 01:21 PM
You walk alongside the main road, feeling the salty spray of the ocean breeze against your face. Geeze, this was going to ruin your hair, wasn't it? The road was familiar to you in its structure, you remember driving down this way... but the road was... cleaner. The railing was shinier. The buildings in the distance looked a little less... worn down? But they were all small details, really easy to miss. The van is missing. You see a couple figures by the ocean's shore instead. Two childlike, one adult. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 01:26 PM
