dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 01:33 PM
They pay you no mind, and make no indication of recognizing your presence. From the distance, you can see sparks of light--sparklers? The fog has eased up and view becomes clearer. An evening by the beach, two children, lighting sparklers with their parent... You can feel a bang of nostalgia in your chest, a wave of homesickness that digs into your body. Yet along with the tides of the shore, that feeling passes all too quickly. There are murmurs and whispers of conversation that you can hear from the distance, but most of the conversation is muddled by the crashing of the waves. They still haven't noticed you. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 01:44 PM

Maybe he could have eavesdropped if he tried harder but Mint doesn't get the impression that it's too deep of a conversation, just a family spending a night together. How nice. dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 01:52 PM
Closer again. From the distance you can see that they really are a family spending the night together on the beach. You could have had this too. Sparks flying, with the squeals of laughter as embers fly a little too close, before extinguishing themselves in the night. It's a beautiful sight actually, the ephemerality of fireworks that exist only to illuminate the night for a moment, forever burned into your memory before fading away. But do things really disappear just because you can't see them anymore? Or will memory make them live forever. Maybe it's the light, but you can feel a slight twinge in your eye. Blink, wipe it away, and you can ignore it for now. The scene in front of you is more interesting to watch. "Too close! I told you to stay awa-------that's hot!" Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 02:02 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:34 PM

They look to be around the same age... maybe around ten? Younger? Identical in look, save for their hair... twins perhaps? Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 02:45 PM

Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 03:11 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 03:26 PM
As you approach the cave... you sense a feeling of unease as the rain pelts at you. You rush into the cave, making your way inside to get out of the pounding rain. Rounded walls that seemed to stretch on a bit further... and... a trail of blood. Are you going to walk away again? @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 03:41 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 03:48 PM
The sound of crying gets closer, as you take careful steps... one into the next. DEATH CW: Two figures are in the distance, your eyes have adjusted enough to the darkness to make out the figures with the little light that managed to stream in. One clutched onto the other, murmuring words of begging as they hunched over the body. Your feet drag through the tunnel, splashing noises as you step from one puddle to the next... but the worst part was that the closer you got... the darker the water ran. The scent of rust was too familiar to you at this point and you've studied enough to know that if someone lost this much... they were as good as dead. If you took a closer look, you could see one child holding onto a stiff body in front of them. Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 04:09 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 04:24 PM
He looks directly at you, mouthing.... mouthing something the words are too hard to make out, but you can see the desperation in his eyes as he blinks. Get away. But it's too late now. There's the awful squelching noise of something damp and wet, as it crawls from the interior of the cave in your direction. Cracking, scraping noises as it forces itself out by dragging itself out of the depths of the earth. Your feet feel frozen in place, unmoving, unable to shift yourself away from the situation as you can only wait for it to come closer. The sloshing noises are louder, disgusting even. You want to plug your ears but you feel as if your feet are frozen in place in the face of what's here to come... It arrives. Imposing. As if watching you for eons, to see what is made up of you and your being. To know your fears, to know your desires, and to know who you are... so that it could assimilate your worth into its self. But for today... you are not the target. It slithers, it squeaks, it sloshes, and enters the cw: mild gore/horror corpse that laid in front of you, though by which manner you can't tell for sure. Through her eyes... her mouth... her nose... any available opening..... And then she opens her eyes. "Min....?" Her eyes turn towards you. "Mi--?" And you're thrust into the darkness again. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint

Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 04:42 PM

You feel like you understand less. What's worse? Nothing about Magnolia has changed... ever. It was you. It was always you who was changing. Burdened with the knowledge that sat in the back corner of your mind, a box that was packed full to the brim but shuffled away into a dark corner... all so you didn't have to face it deep within your heart. Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 05:41 PM
Right. He was the one who grew up. He was the one who decided to leave, every step that deteriorated their relationship was took by him. Why his romantic partners always felt like something was missing with him. Why he end up always coming back. Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 06:13 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 06:24 PM
The door opens, welcoming you into its space. It's a simple room, any other decor would be unnecessary for what needs to be shown. And on the table. Is a box. You've opened it before. And you didn't like what was inside. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 09:48 PM
More boxes? He presses his hands between his temples...in an odd moment of clarity, he recalled the agency's case files. The ones where the anomalies were described as messing with the detective's head. Those paperwork were always vague. Even his mom failed to put details in her experience, an abnormality considering her usual lenghty, comprehensive notes. Well. He knows why now. There's no way he'll submit an essay about his mommy issues for paperwork. He paused as long as he had to before shaking the box and opening it. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 09:58 PM
Inside you find letters. From "Dove". Newspaper clippings, written testimonials, reports, and snippets of documents. All leading to Magnolia's.... Life's goals... (You didn't want to call them crimes.) But they were there, the evidence that you wanted to ignore, the letters that you thought you burnt... Every time you see these, your image of your mother shatters before your eyes. Do you want to study anomalies to become closer to her? Or are you trying to convince yourself that if you do the same thing she does... that you'll turn out differently? Well... the facts are on the table in front of you. Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 10:11 PM
He rips everything up without reading them, one by one. If they keep coming back, then he will choose to keep destroying them. The world is unfair, for his mother to get away with everything. But he has no desire for fairness as he still wants to see his mother's smile, more than anything else in the world. dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 10:27 PM
The door swings upon and inside you see... Magnolia. Like always. You could almost scoff at the fact that anomalies tried to show you the same scene, every single time. Like clockwork, they would show you yourself, what you hated, and who you missed. So what's the catch this time? If you peer inside, you'll notice that this isn't the apartment you're typically familiar with. It's a brighter... quainter place, with handicrafts littering the sofas, knitted throws and embroidered pillows. The photos on the wall are full of photos of you and your mother. You haven't had the opportunity to go on vacation often... but that didn't mean there wasn't a chance for photos. The two of you are smiling, or smiling as much as you typically do. Your photos from childhood are just the same as you remember. Small little Mint, clinging onto his mother for as long as he could remember. But as the years progress, some of your photos shifted into something different in your memory, shoulders tense and mouth pursed... but in these you seem... relaxed? It doesn't look like anything is different- it doesn't look like anything has changed. There are still documents placed around the house, documents about Magnolia's work... or more specifically- You draw up a blank. Or at least, you get the feeling that you should. And that's when the realization hits. It's not that anything about your mother has changed... it's you. It's always been you. It's a scenario where you never received that damn box, a moment in time where you could spend time with your mother as you remembered her before the knowledge hit. What was the saying? Ignorance is bliss? If you step in, you could take an opportunity to live without that crushing doom over your head, the knowledge that hung over your neck as if your neck was on the chopping block... Or you could close the door. And head back to the box that was waiting for you on the table. Choices have consequences. @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint
Malachy Faragher BOT 05-Nov-22 10:38 PM
Isn't this what he always wanted? He wanted it so much that he knew that he was asking for the impossible, like a child who still believes in wishing stars. That life full of bliss isn't his, it will always be out of his reach. The mother that was always kind, always taking care of him, doesn't exist anymore. You're 27, for God's sake. You're too old for fairy tales and happily ever afters. You're burdened with the knowledge that this is not how the world works. It's simply too good to be true when he did nothing to earn it, he slammed the door back shut. @dodo | luka
3
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 11:07 PM
You decide to live with the truth, to focus on the truth, and embrace the truth. The same one that you chose to ignore again and again. You ran so far away, and what did it bring you? Nothing really. So you sit in this room, on a chair, and stare at the box in front of you. Maybe you'll spend time opening the box to examine the contents- words seared into your mind to the point where you could recite them word by word. Or maybe you'll tear them continuously one by one, till your fingertips turn red and raw from the constant friction against paper. The shreds that slowly gather around your feet for what feels like eons soon pile up to your ankles... your knees... your thighs... your waist... You are seated in a sea of paper fragments, each piece highlighting an incriminating word for the person you love most in the world. Dove... a bird of peace, freedom, of love. Was it love that they sent this letter out of? Love that threatened to break the bond between a son and his mother? (Deep down in your heart, you knew love meant doing whatever was best for the other person... but what did that even mean?) Dove, a symbol of cooperation and hope, of peace of the purist kind. Hours, or even days into the simulation-- you've lost all track of time right now-- you bark out in laughter. How ironic that a messenger of peace drove such a wedge into your heart. You thought this was the better solution, to live in the reality of what's before you. Your eye burns again, a crawling sensation from within that has you clutch your head in the pain. But at the same time you can't stop reading. Thirteen people dead. One missing. Accusations of blackmail. Letters from your mother, Dove. Dove wasn't your mother. You had Magnolia, and now Jiyeon. The time passes, but there's no clock to tell you how long. You read for an eternity alone in the room, praying that you don't become like the person you see on the paper before you. You don't have anything else to do.

[ NO HONOR IN DEATH ] ;You chose the truth, even if it eats you up from the inside. FIN. THANK YOU & SEE YOU TOMORROW! @Puchigeist 🌿 Magnolia & Mint

🌾 TO GUIDE OR BE GUIDED / quincy
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:18 PM
You wake up. Jolting upright after the events at hand. If you take a look over yourself right now, you'd notice first and foremost... You're alone. There is no Seven, there is no Charlotte, there's only you... You and... the chirping of cicadas, the warm shine of the afternoon sun, the sweltering heat of the pavement you found yourself on. You don't feel... hurt at least. Even the knee you scraped (which you claimed stopped hurting after you received a little kiss on it), was of no consequence. If anything, you felt fine. As if the blood and the cave were all a dream that could easily be forgotten. It's nice... to bask in the afternoon sun so leisurely like this... But you're a detective Quincy Carter, and detectives have work to do. @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf
chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf 05-Nov-22 02:30 PM
"Ahhh, not this again..." Quincy scratches her head, ruffling her hair as she picks herself up off the ground and takes a look around. Cupping her hands around her mouth, she takes a deep breath and calls out, "SEEEVENNNNN." She knows it's futile to call out for him like this, especially if it's a classic anomaly pocket dimension situation again, whether its all just in her head, or she really did get transported somewhere is the question. She could also be dead, but it's hard to tell these days. One thing's for sure, everything may or may not be real, and she needs to be on the look out for anything that wants to mess with her psyche. In any case, let's see what this anomaly has in store. Quincy starts walking forward. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 02:40 PM

In the silence of the rural countryside, you can hear the slight bickering coming from a street over, children's voices. Low murmurs against the rustling of the leaves. You recognize the area though. You're back in the village where it all started. @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf
chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf 05-Nov-22 02:44 PM

dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 03:20 PM
As you walk you notice that things get larger than usual, you need more steps to get from one point to the next... and overall you feel like you recognize these small (well.. now large in your eyes) streets... like it was home to you. So you make twists and turns easily from one corner to the next, hands increasingly struggle to wrap around the giant backpack you decided to bring with you (geeze, why did you pack so many things?). Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of yourself in a storefront window... You're... much smaller than before? No less than ten, no more than twelve. And you round the corner to see one child on the ground and another child sitting top of him. One child shields themselves from the continuous pummeling that came from above, the other child enraged, landed punch after punch. There was no blood, even with the violence, their fists weren't enough to make that much of an impact, nor were they very accurate... with the tears streaming down their faces. @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf
Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:39 PM
"Eh? Seriously?" This was surprising, and the fact that she could recognise these streets is also unnerving. Taking a deep breath, Quincy puts on her thinking face, thumg and finger on her chin as she starts mumbling, "It seems like the anomaly is either pulling things from my memory, or planting things in my memory..." It helped to break things down like this, out loud, to remind her of who she really is and where she is. No more getting caught up in things! She's capable now!! Or... at least a little better than before. But once Quincy turns the corner, and sees a little kid getting beat up, all logical thoughts are out the window as she immediately runs to their rescue. Her bag is slipped off to throw at the child on top of the other child. "Hey!! Stop that!!" She yells. @dodo | luka
5
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 03:55 PM
The backpack hurtles towards the child throwing the punches, her body thrown off under the weight of the back as she falls to the side. Almost immediately, she gets back up, furiously wiping the tears from her eyes as she scans the area, before focusing her sights on you. Recognition. Sadness. Betrayal. Rage. The emotions flash through her face, before she stands up, backpack in hand and runs towards you. "You're supposed to be... on my side!" She's crying, tears streaming down her face as she hits you with the backpack. "Even if everyone else.... I was defending you!" She angrily runs a sleeve against her eyes. She doesn't want to cry... or look weak, not in front of the crowd of kids that started to accumulate. "Useless, stupid, older brother!" She's angry, but you can tell she doesn't mean it... not really. "They were making fun of us, not just me. I'm not going to just..." ...let them continue. Let them ridicule you. You were too precious for her to let that kind of comment slide. @chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf (edited)
chrismickey 🍑 quincy elf 05-Nov-22 04:02 PM

Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:12 PM
OH. SHE FUCKED UP, Quincy is too shocked to fight back and takes the brunt of the girl's anger. She doesn't catch the backpack in time after it hits her, and she plucks it off the ground after it lands. Big brother.. This isn't her first rodeo at playing that part, and there is a pang of guilt in her chest as the girl screams at her. A latent instinct of being an older sibling takes over. As a crowd of kids gather, "I... I am on your side." Quincy takes her wrist and attempts to pull her away, "C'mon, let's-- let's go somewhere else first-" somewhere quiet, somewhere a little more private where they wouldn't be the center of attention. @dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 04:30 PM

Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:48 PM

Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:28 PM
Quincy calmly floats from the ocean, to the darkness. Her hands clasp together and rests on her stomach. Somehow... it didn't feel scary... not anymore, not like it used to. dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 07:56 PM

Quincy Carter (he/she) BOT 05-Nov-22 09:16 PM
Of course the void didn’t answer. It leaves her question hanging in the air. Are you sad? So she answers it herself, ”No, I’m happy.” And she can say that now, genuinely, with a smile on her face. Standing here, at the steps of LQCC, she recalls a moment very similar to this. After the events of Pleasantville when the cool night air made her question who she is. Whether she has had a negative or positive effect, the truth of the matter is that IT IS her fault. Things happened because of her. One way or another, it was her, it’s always her. She is Quincy Carter. It isn’t the other way around. She is coming to realise that now, of all times. She can let the anomaly affect her, or take matters into her own hands. She can be a cause and not the effect. Quincy looks at the scene before her, the open door, the welcoming arms, the party waiting for her. But this was just like a dream, like a lucid dream. Try as she might, she cannot remember how the the mission ended, and she should remember because she keeps a very comprehensive diary of her everyday life. The memory, though distant it’s there- she hasn’t forgotten the void, the memory she was made to experience and the lingering guilt of the child saved by his sister. She remembers the way she has been tossed from one moment to another. There is a temptation being dangled in front of her, as they have always done, and of course she wants to go in. But she doesn’t, because this mission isn’t over yet, and Quincy Carter you have a job to do. She can’t wait for the others to pull her out of this anymore, she can’t keep relying on the people that believe in her. She has to get out of this herself. If she dies today, right now, there will be people who will remember her, and it’s not just Seven or Rhett. There are more people that she has affected with her actions whether good, or bad.
21:16
If she has to go, she doesn’t want to just be remembered, she wants to be remembered for doing something great. There are people waiting for her after all, and it’s not in there. Her lips part into a toothy smile, “Thanks.” For the reminder! One step, two steps back, then Quincy Carter turns around and runs into the road, towards oncoming traffic. She’s betting her life on this. Now wake up, and “LET ME OUT!!”

@dodo | luka
dodo | luka 05-Nov-22 09:42 PM
It. Really. Hurts. You, Quincy Carter, decided to throw yourself into oncoming traffic. You see in front of you, the appalled faces of your coworkers, the stricken looks of--? You don't really see their faces, so all is alright with you. Instead you drop yourself in front of an incoming truck and brace for impact. Your life, so easily tossed away in a moment... Or at least that is what you believe for a moment. The blinding pain keeps you awake, the inscriptions that burn themselves onto your arms acting as a reminder for your foolish act. It hurts, it burns, it spreads. It feels as if it is making every mark across your body as a reminder... a reminder... You're not dead yet. The pain means that you can still feel, the blinding hot red that flashes before your eyes acting as a reminder that you can still breathe. The creaking of your ribs as they let air into your lungs, the twitching of your arm that signals that you can still move. It hurts like hell, but you sure as hell know you're alive. The sweet embrace of darkness means nothing as you chortle out a laugh, or try to at least. There's fluid in your mouth, thick and rusty and it is definitely blood. But the adrenaline keeps your body moving as you laugh amidst the sirens blaring, the people screaming, and the onlookers that try to crowd around what you assume is to be your mangled body... But to be honest, aside from the burning pain and the blood flowing out of your mouth, the creaking and aching of your body... you've never felt better. Euphoria? Perhaps from defying god itself, from choosing your own actions, to paving your own path. Someone would look at your tired and battered body on the ground and see you as something... pitiful. But this was a win in your own right, beaten and bruised and all. Besides, didn't they say bruises made peaches sweeter? This, is what made you so great.

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:14 PM
[THE DARKNESS CLOSES IN AROUND YOU...] ;And, like always, you accept it. You wake up from a sleep you didn't know you took with a start. You have a blanket wrapped around your small shoulders, cold enough to necessitate drawing your shoulders in and pulling the blanket closer to your body. Contrasting to the cold, there's a warmth right in front of you, a flame that crackles merrily. Its red fingers lick against the night sky, and you become vaguely aware of someone beside you, sitting down with a sigh. "It's cold," they complain. They sound younger than you. "Give me your blanket, oppa."
@hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
Sang-hoon BOT 05-Nov-22 03:40 PM
It's weird, nothing feels right. Normally, Sang-hoon would embrace that and go with the flow, but this time, there's an unbearable weight that comes with it, far too heavy for someone like them to carry. Or maybe it's because they feel different, smaller and weaker, that they're unable to handle the changes in atmosphere. Their eyes flutter open, confused, though they look to the side and wordlessly offer their blanket to the younger voice. They always took care of people smaller than them. "Here," they rub their eye, tired. "I don't need it."
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 04:04 PM
"Thanks," she says, all fake-sweet, and hands you a foil-wrapped potato. The fire burns warmly — oh, you're supposed to roast these. It'll take a while, and you're already regretting giving up your blanket, but as soon as you think it the blanket once again finds its way over your shoulders. Your sister sits beside you instead, sharing in the blanket. Her cold arm presses against yours, and you're a little grateful for the warmth you both share now, underneath the blanket. "Can you cook the potato? I'm hungry." On cue, her stomach rumbles.
@hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
Sang-hoon BOT 05-Nov-22 04:19 PM
They look at their hands in front of the fire before taking the potato. They're grateful for the warmth but otherwise don't feel anything for it. In a situation like this, it wonders what the most appropriate response would be — who are they? Given the circumstances, Sang-hoon can gather they must be on their own, fending for themselves out on the cold streets (or perhaps they're just camping, or run away from home. Either way, Sang-hoon's mind drifts to the worst case scenario), and it wants to know exactly who it is right now. Mindlessly, they thrust their hand into the fire, letting the potato cook and its hand burn. Regardless of the circumstances right now, it's aware enough to understand that nothing here is real. It's simply in a dream, a distant memory that doesn't concern it. Maybe it doesn't even hurt, but more than that, it's hoping it'll wake up. "Who are we?"

You are, of course, Sang-hoon Kang. LQCC detective, here to investigate a few missing people. But you didn't really care. There is no limits to caring for you, really. You'd do the same for someone you loved. It does hurt. You can tell you'll have to run some cold water under it, but it'll still turn into a burn. The consequences of your actions. You are still miserably trapped under a weight of a memory that is not yours. "You are being stupid. I am trying to keep you from killing yourself," she scolds. "I know you think you're immune to this, but still. Don't do that. You don't have to show off. I know every side of you."

They reflect what are supposed to be corpses millions of light years away, not that you care. You never really cared. It's just fun, and if it wasn't, then you stop replying. He's clean-shaven, hair freshly buzzed, just like when you first met him. "You always scare me," he notes disapprovingly. "But that just means I'm not too fucked in the head to leave you where you should be, by your own."
@hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
4
Sang-hoon BOT 05-Nov-22 07:48 PM
They were about to say something stupid to retort, but the words die on the tip of their tongue after hearing that all-too familiar voice instead. Their head snaps to the side, eyes wide at the sight of Nicolas's old appearance — a twinge of... pain? anger? sadness? makes its chest tighten up in some sort of twisted anxiety. It's a different kind of feeling than how they normally feel seeing him in their day to day. Perhaps this is what nostalgia feels like. "...The hell are you talking about?" Sang-hoon's already neutral expression drops into an even deeper frown, disapproving. Their hand balls up into a fist, squeezing and then relaxing as some self-soothing action. "I don't remember giving you permission to talk to me." Anything they want to say is immediately replaced by distance, keeping Nic at arm's length even now, when he hasn't even done anything wrong. Something in the back of their mind is scolding them for being so harsh now, but they forcibly push that voice down in favor of keeping up its own pride. "Maybe you should've left me alone anyway."
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 08:24 PM
"I don't remember giving you permission to give me permission," he snipes back, but his smile is a playful one. He disguises the fondness between a hand, coughs into his cigarette when he finds the closeness of you unbearable. He smokes a bit as he meditates on the answer. "Too late for regrets now, Kang," he declares, eyes shooting to watch you from the corner he's perched on. There's no pity, or understanding, or frustration; he just rolls with the punches like he used to, an easy relationship between you both that had a name but neither of you wanted to put any label on. "Maybe you shouldn't have followed if you didn't want this path. And yet here we are." Another puff of his cigarette, another inhale. "Hey, I'm moving out of this city soon." He rubs the back of his neck. "Meteor City's too much. You wanna come somewhere abroad? There'll still be fun. I mean, as long as you're with me." Choices have consequences.
@hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
Sang-hoon BOT 05-Nov-22 08:37 PM
What's with this overfamiliarity? It makes Sang-hoon uncomfortable, no longer used to their closeness. The way things used to be... it was nice, but they know better now — it could never be like this again, and it's too late for regrets. Still, wouldn't they be lying if they said they didn't miss it? Without anyone else knowing, they look back on these memories fondly, and despite how hard they try to not care, there are still pictures left untouched, unvandalized by Sang-hoon's rage and kept pristine through the years. They're there just in case, for whatever reason, even if they don't look at them as much as they used to. "You're right, I shouldn't have followed either," but they did anyway, because they believed in him. They exhale, fanning away the smoke from their face with a grimace. Somehow, it's a little hard to be as angry as they once were, seeing Nic's face like this again, before everything went south. Sang-hoon runs their fingers through their hair — is it longer now too? No, they should remember that Nic always was that kind of person. A liar and a traitor. If they gave in to the hallucinations now, what was everything for? Sang-hoon hates these kinds of anomalies, if that's what's causing all of this. Just let them keep their memories and life in peace. "...Let me ask you something first," they look at Nic properly. There he is. There they are. "Why me?"
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 08:57 PM
The hair stops just short of your nape, from the time you cut it, tried to reinvent yourself. Of course, it's gotten a little longer, but it's only because you haven't been able to keep it maintained, these days. Nic stares at you as if it's the most obvious question in the world, with the answer looking at you right in the face. Whatever he sees in Sang-hoon's face makes him smile, like someone who has too many weaknesses that can be exploited one day. He ducks his head. "Why not you?" He muses. "I chose you for a reason when we talked, that very first day in a bar. And you chose me. Don't blame for the decisions you make, Kang. You only ever wanted this." He glances out at Meteor City's streets. "Last chance. Seriously. I don't mind if you don't, but it's a damn shame." He starts to move towards the door, taking your non-answer for a refusal.
@hyulidays👓 albert 🕶 sang-hoon
1
Sang-hoon BOT 05-Nov-22 09:33 PM
That's a pretty non-answer too, Sang-hoon thinks. What does it answer? It only tells them that Nicolas was still stupid even when they first met. Their first meeting... They aren't sure if they want to think back on it fondly or with bitterness — maybe both. They remember it was just a chance meeting, two strangers alone at a bar, one who wanted to make friends with everyone and another that couldn't wait to knock his lights out. For some reason, he managed to break through the layers of walls Sang-hoon built around itself, not for protection, but because it was merely apathetic to the world. He was the only one to do so, to be able to dig deep into its core and see exactly what they wanted. Nic gave them everything from a job and a friend to feelings. For that, Sang-hoon will never forgive him. And almost as fast as they felt something, Nic also snatched it away. Well, maybe not exactly. What's left now isn't some sort of excitement, an eagerness for life and what the next day has to offer, but it's anger and rage. Their passion simply morphed into something worse, and that kind of power is too much for one man to handle. That's why they can't stand seeing him, even now, and Sang-hoon suppresses the urge to knock him senseless. Nic is right, though, when he says that Sang-hoon chose him too. It was equally their fault that they let their guard down and allowed someone like him to worm his way into their heart, just enough that he could set off such an explosion inside. Every day, they wonder what would've happened if Nic didn't ruin everything, if he didn't go fuck everyone over and leave Sang-hoon wondering what it was all for. They're sure they could've made it big — just the two of them — and taken on anything the world could throw at them. That's all they ever wanted, probably. It would've been fun. Knowing what they know now, it's only natural that they would reject the other's offer — why would they run off with Nicolas Rosenthal, the man who
21:33
(would, eventually) screw over their life and everything they loved? But something inside of them hesitates, looking at his awfully innocent and annoying expression, that stupid grin plastered on his face. Why would he even smile looking at someone like Sang-hoon... They flex their hand again, a slight tingling sensation still burning there. "I..." The last chance, a damn shame. That's right. Even if this is a dream, or some hallucination brought on by some anomaly, at the end of the day this isn't real. None of their actions have any real consequences here, and they can do whatever they want; whatever is more fun. Ultimately, choosing its own pride and going their separate ways is boring. They've already done that, and they know how it ends. Sang-hoon is curious about taking another route, one they've never seen before. As much as they hate situations like this, they'll just have to learn to adapt, and find something interesting. "You're going to get lost in some foreign city and get murdered alone on a forgotten path," They walk up behind Nic, and lightly kick him through the door. "I'll go with you." They act as if it's real, as if they're really going somewhere together. For a moment, they think that they've made a mistake, but think they'll also break out of it whenever they want. They know they can, even if they get caught up in the whirlwind called Nicolas Rosenthal again.
@ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 09:59 PM
There is no sense in a repeated narrative. After all, when it came down to it, you wouldn't watch a movie twice when you already lived it out. So what do you think your life might've changed by if Nic had told you from the start what he wanted? No, rather — if Nic had kept his stupid mouth shut and decided to something else other than being a big damn hero, and just leaving and taking you with him? You could've still been friends. You could've still been more, that nameless, faithful relationship. He doesn't budge when you kick him but bats at you, grabbing your arm and pulling you down the staircase, two steps at a time. It's the first time in a long time that you feel excited. "I hope we die together," he reports cheerfully. This is how it was last time. You said to yourself, just temporary. You said to yourself, I can stop whenever I want. But when all the cards were down, you still continued. Because... because... The word is so foreign to you. But you know if you make this choice that hole in your shoulderblade will stop burning eventually and you'll find something new. Together or apart. Everyone be damned, you'll at least make it fun. [NO HONOR IN SACRIFICE] ;No honor in falling in love, either. Just lots and lots of pain.

🌾 TO GUIDE OR BE GUIDED / seven
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 02:53 PM
[THE DARKNESS CLOSES IN AROUND YOU...] ;Fish in a net. The world blooms white upon your waking, and your breath comes out in exhales in the chill of the winter, clear signs of your life. Spindly branches of trees line the boulevard of your vision, gnarled shadows reaching up to the sky as the winter releases the glimmering shards of snowflakes upon you. You feel... smaller, somehow, a little compact. You are still yourself, but have you ever celebrated a white Christmas, Seven? What kind of memories do you hold of your family during the holiday season? The hand in yours is still a warmth familiar to you, but you are no longer in any rush to run — but will you?
@Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
3
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:11 PM
Christmas for the longest time was anything but enjoyable after his father had left. Most often he would be left working the winery with the remaining household, clamboring to get the last of their merchandise for the year settled away. You'd think of it similar to Santa's workshop but instead of an old, jolly man leading his thousand of joyful elves there was young Seven, a mere teenager directing the lives of the few leftover employees who still dedicated themselves to the craft and the Jacobs' name. Some out of pity and others just to see what would become of the once grand name. Before all that though... Things were normal. Decorations decked out the ranch entirely. The largest Christmas tree that could be found propped up in the living room with the smell of molasses and chocolate all throughout. Presents by the piles and fake snow dusting the fire place. He'd remember vaguely also that every year that they had this strange little elf as well that would always be moving around... What was all that about? Seven couldn't quite remember except that it was exciting to wake up every morning to find it. Eyes slowly blink up into the white sky, watching as snowflakes begin to softly flutter and melt into his lashes. Seven brings his hand up to catch them. It rarely snowed in Australia but it was especially rare in Tasmania, the farthest south state there was. He wants to run and see more, feeling a little giddy at the sight but he looks up to the hand he is holding. Is that okay? Can he go? @ksh's darling pookie sweetums srry for long
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:31 PM
What seems to be a mother — not yours, but clearly this is the situation you're in, and you're here to play the part — bends down and smiles at you, the wrinkles on her face folding with genuine delight as she readjusts the hat on your head, tucks the red scarf wrapped around your neck tighter into your parka. You feel a little bloated, but that's okay because you're warm, and that's what matters. "Go play with your sibling, Sumin-ah," she says, pinching your cheek as she smiles. You can tell she loves you. Lots and lots. Over the crest of a hill what seems to be a father is holding a sled, making sure an even littler person is strapped in there, making sure she's safe. What seems to be a mother points them out to you, releasing your hand as she gently pushes you towards them.
@Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:38 PM
There's an ache in his chest as the mother fusses over him, gentle fingers stroking his cheek and warm, loving eyes looking down at him. Familiar but not so familiar. The name was not his but at her encouragement, Seven finds himself automatically nodding and turning to waddle over to the rest of his family. Taking steady and even steps through the snow, careful not to fall. How could he say no to such a wonderful mother? The snow crunches beneath his feet as he makes his way forward, hopping and skipping over some bigger piles of ice. Was snow always this fun? @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:47 PM
You make your slow, careful way up the hill. It's not that big of a hill, but it's gargantuan to a nine-year-old. You've seen snow, in pictures and movies. It's soft and pillowy, and it'll get all gross and yucky when the heat sweeps in and it melts layer by layer, but for now it's pristine and perfect. To your question — it was always this fun. Nostalgia tended to soften memory and make them more touching than what they were, in reality. Maybe if you had a family like this, it wouldn't be so painful to look back on. "Hurry up!" Your sibling yells at you, gripping the edges of the sled. When she sees you she pats the space in front of her. You're the big brother, so you take the fall in case they turn over. Your father has his camera out, taking pictures and telling her to be patient, wait her turn, and then beckons you to join the family.
@Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:56 PM
With his sibling yelling at him, Seven pushed forward up that hill, huffing and puffing into the cold air. His warm breath could be seen in clouds before him and after what seemed like hours (it was probably only five minutes) he finally arrived at the peak of the mountain (hill). He slows to a meager trot as he tries his best to hold in his struggling pants. Phew, that took a lot out of him. He drags his feet over to the sled without another word, sliding into the spot in front of her. He poses for the camera, holding up two fingers in an awkward V. At this point, Seven was able to start distinguishing fantasy to reality. There was no such happiness like this in his life. Not anymore. But he couldn't help himself to try and enjoy what he could have had even if it was under the influence of some sort of anomaly or what. His brain, although fuzzy, was absently trying to sort its thoughts. Where was he? Who was he? And why was he here? @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 04:28 PM
There's nothing wrong with being happy — even if the root wasn't your memories, and you were living someone else's life. It seemed like even strangers had a better childhood than you, and that despite it all, you could still find comfort in the brief sparks of joy of being with a family more than you ever could with your years and years of awkward family dinners and quiet manoeuvring around each other. Of course, that all stopped after your mother could barely lift a spoon. But think happy thoughts, Seven. That is your name, right? Seven Jacobs. Detective of LQCC. You are here to investigate a disappearance — you've never truly forgotten, but you were caught up in the memory's warmth that you didn't realize. There is no influence other than the odd situation in front of you. Your sister wraps her arms around you, giggling. "Hold on tight, Min-ah!" You stare down the hill you just climbed, and before you can open your mouth you are sent rushing down the sled of snow, the exhilarating thrill lifting your dark hair and making your warm cheeks hotter. And then — oh, you've gone too fast. Your face meets the snow first, and then the rest of your body. You don't crunch but it certainly does hurt a bit, alleviated by the person who's wrapped herself around you, trying to protect you. Snow gets in between every uncomfortable crevice as you process what just happened, the equivalent of a car crash except with a sled in soft snow. The girl — your sister — is still hugging you, protecting you. @Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs (edited)

Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:45 PM
It all happens very quickly. Seven finds himself sliding through the snow, the icy air nipping at his bare cheeks and nose. Eyes blinking through the stray snowfall that was piercing through his lashes. In the next moment, his vision is clouded by white. There's a grunt and a yelp, though he's not quite sure from whom, and he tumbles face first into the snow. A soft groan is heard and he tries to wipe away the snow from his face, dusting some into his jacket and causing shivers down his spine as it immediately melts into his warm skin. He peeks around himself to see his sister holding onto him tightly and he freezes. Wasn't there someone else doing the same thing earlier? His brain itches and he momentarily sees a flash of orange hair. The thought is quickly dismissed as he remembers what had just happened and pulls his sister to him, concern lacing his features as he tries to see if she was okay. "Are you hurt?!" His voice is light, young. A surprise to himself. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 05:05 PM
"Nuh uh," she responds back in a voice similar to yours, pulling back. Snot is running down her nose and she's grinning, snow piled on her head. If you squint enough, the winter sun turns her hair almost red with its light. Ah, so this is what must feel like to have a family. It's... nice. Then she shoves some snow down the front of your jacket, in between the layers, and gets up, giggling. She stumbles a bit, no doubt a side-effect from getting tossed by the sled, but uses the opportunity to make a hamfisted snowball, aiming at your face but only getting your shoulder. "Ya gotta catch me!"
@Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:20 PM
The contrast of the girls hair to the white snow behind her was stunning to say the least but he hardly had time to admire it let alone wipe her nose before he's assaulted with the cold once more. Seven lets out a scream as he gets up and tries to shake the snow out from his front. The water seeps downwards from his chest to his belly and he rubs over his jacket to try and soak it up with his shirt and keep himself semi-warm. He can barely even gather his wits about him when the snowball hits his shoulder and a playful glare settles on his expression. "Hold it right there!" He demands and bends over to clumsily scoop up a handful of snow into each hand. Seven had no experience with snowballs but was able to somehow pack two pristine ones. He goes into a sprint after his sister, winding back his arm as he tries to toss them at her general direction, not to hard as to hurt her but enough to give them some speed. He's hopping and bounding over the thick snow in a game of giggly chase, completely ignoring the cold seeping through his jacket. Unfamiliar. A sibling bond was something he never experienced. Though he knew why given the meaning of his own name. Well, if he thought about it he technically did have a sibling... but neither had a bond to each other quite like this. ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 05:50 PM
There's no snow in Australia, but there is plenty of snow in Meteor City. And though you've celebrated your first few Christmases alone, last year you had two other people. A cake, between you three. The snow became special after having someone special to celebrate it with you. But what happens when they go, and take all that warmth with you? The snow is only so nice because you had somewhere safe and warm to retreat to. After that, the snow is just snow. Unforgiving. Harsh. Cold. Sapping your living sense. It serves as a juxtaposition of everything you stood to lose, and what else you might find to gain. The incantation throbs against your throat, forcing you to return to yourself, but just barely. You run, through the snow, and you end up at the front of your apartment. The one in Meteor City. Oh, it feels good to finally be home, from the snow. You see two familiar shadows dart from windows above you, waiting for you. Clearly. They can't start without you. Do you go in? Choices have consequences.
@Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:09 PM
Seven remembered last Christmas at his apartment vividly. The excessive decorations Quincy brought in everyday took up 80% of living room and there was barely any room to even walk through the apartment comfortably. It was noisy and crowded but it was warm and comforting all the same. The year had flown by and the season was upon them once more but things were already vastly different now than they were a year ago... with himself especially. Fingers brush over his eye, smoothing out the fabric of the eyepatch. He's gotten used to loss to an extent but losing people was always a difficulty. Seven was never good at letting people go. They're the ones who wanted to to come into his life so why let them into your hearts if they're going to leave afterwards? That's not fair. He wouldn't let them. Emotions surges and he blinks. Oh, he's at the apartment. Home. He takes a few steps towards the building and reaches for the door handle but pauses, throwing a glance behind him. Wait, what was he doing again? Wasn't he chasing someone? "..." His hand withdraws and he steps back once before turning to the street. This isn't right. This wasn't what he was here for. He looks back up to the window, the warm light pouring out calling to him. "Hello?" He calls to the window. Then to the street. Was this real? Or is it still a dream? @Mimmy ☆ Seven "Normal" Jacobs
Seven Jacobs (he/him) BOT 05-Nov-22 07:03 PM

Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 03:14 PM
She sits up slowly, rubbing at her head without thinking about it. She keeps blinking, keeps waiting for things to go back to normal, waiting to wake up. Time passes. With each half breath, she pauses between inhale and exhale. It's a wish, a manifestation. Willing this moment to end. Who knows how long she sits and stares at the body laying near her - but she doesn't approach. Instead, she finally stands, hands grasping the walls for support, and turns away. She's already decided. That's not Mint. All she has to do is leave - get somewhere far enough away from here and the smell and the body and the darkness, and she'll be able to believe it. And then none of this will be real. She starts moving unsteadily in whatever direction takes her away. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums
ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 03:44 PM
The minutes glide into hours without any avail. You still feel every part of your body — rough, sore, tired, unyielding, screaming, but refusing to let you bend. What they must all be stuck under. Why are you the only one left on this side of the bank, dry? You stand up. You choose not to look, but the reality of the situation is dawning on you. You're stuck. Here. Your right calf throbs, the skin connected to sinew and muscle. You know without looking that a mark burns itself there. You turn around and reenter the guest bedroom. Blood from a head wound from when you fell starts to dry, making the right side of your face feel crusty. Your eye closes in response, weakening sight to peer at the world underneath your dark lashes. The bedroom is the same as how you left it — searched, violated. Your heart starts to pick up. When are things going to change? When? Is it a relief to hear someone head down the stairs, above your head? Descending from within the home? Who was that? Is it finally time to go to sleep?
@scarecROY 💜👻 tima
Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 04:09 PM
She's so tired. There's no one here to giggle or bat her eyelashes at, no one to pretend for, no one to comfort her or wipe the dried blood from her eye. She doesn't want to be here anymore, in this place more nightmare than reality. ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 04:41 PM
Okay. You can leave. There's only so far you can run, without resources. The windows — you don't have to hurtle yourself through them, but maybe pain will wake you up from this dream. It's torturous to draw your still-asleep body to the window, but you manage to fumble with the latch and open it, pushing yourself out. Only the first story, so it doesn't even hurt, just like stepping over a couch. You land in a bush of withered cosmos, all red and white, or what they formerly were before they died. Their corpses still decorate the dirt ground, a small defiance to decomposition. Time has moved on. It was afternoon but now it's a begrudging dusk, painting the edges of the sky a deep violet. The sounds of the village are a little quiet, but that might be how it is always, for a place with less than a hundred people. Your head tips back and hits the wall of the home, looking up at the starry sky. It's not the same view from home, nor is it the one fogged by Meteor City smog, but it has always been the same sky. ... What now? You're still waiting but you're not sure if anything will come. For better or worse, you're the only one still 'outside', looking 'in'.
@scarecROY 💜👻 tima
Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 05:37 PM
This is how it's always been, isn't it? Tima sits, in the bed of dying flowers, eyes staring upwards. It's her choice, it's always been her choice - to leave rather than stay, to safely stand on the outside, rather than risk the unknowns inside. To distance herself from this world, in search of something more. She's there right now, and she feels no relief. But that only means she hasn't gone far enough, right? She should keep running. Out of this house and its yard. Out of the village. She knows there's a port nearby. A place where people leave behind debts and relationships and escape into nothingness. That could be her - just another missing person, a mystery left unsolved. She could escape it all - after all, what was one more body haunting her dreams? She laughs and it turns into a choked sob. She doesn't get up. Do you even remember how to be a real person anymore? To be anything other than a specter phasing through walls, running and searching and waiting for that moment when it's finally safe enough to wake up?* She bites down a scream and uses what little strength she has left to grab a handful of decaying cosmos, ripping them from the earth. It's a meaningless action, an impulse born of frustration and terror and grief - anything to remind herself that this world, real or not, is something she can still touch. She's so afraid that one day it won't be. That this choice has become a *trap. The beautiful veneer, now stained with blood and ink and symbols she doesn't understand, is flaking away. It's cold outside. She thinks, mournfully, and closes her eyes - turning away from the endless sky. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 06:05 PM
The flowers crumble in your grasp, making no impact on anyone except you, who rips it up for your own sake. A transitory, half-meaningless existence, pretty only for a short while, blooming into nonexistence. You, unbloomed, will continue to wither. The seasons come and go, but you still remain the same. What little impact you have shows briefly in the lives you touched, but ten, twenty, thirty years down the line — what might happen? Will someone touch their lips against yours and bring you back to life? Will someone brush the grave dirt off you? This life is — was — a hard one. From the very start, the cards were stacked against you. This work is hard, too, but you still toil to see if you can find anything of value among the roots of the dead. The inscription throbs against your head, feels like a brand that you'll remember even in your sleep, hands tracing patterns against the floor. Fatima Almeida. You are, in all cases, legally dead. If you died now, no one would fault you. But the flowers bloom underneath you, returning to life. Your touch restores them. It heals. You feel gross and dirty and disgusting, but the window bangs open — footsteps — the people from within the house. Your coworker, Mint, clears the window, eyes widening when he sees you hidden among the bushes. He grabs your shoulder and pulls you up, pulling you into a hug. "You — we did it! We finished the mission! We can go home!" Well, is it? Time to go home? Choices have consequences.
@scarecROY 💜👻 tima
 (edited)
Tima Almeida (she/they) BOT 05-Nov-22 06:50 PM
She swallows, throat dry, once again on the verge of tears. Isn't this what she's always wanted? What she wished for? Words spoken from a different set of lips perhaps, but still resonant in how closely they strike to her heart. She stands there motionless in Mint's embrace, the feeling of flowers blooming beneath her fingers. Is this what it feels like to be alive? Can the truth she's been running from be as beautiful and picturesque as her dreams? (Of course not.) She's not stupid. Even back then, when she didn't have the knowledge, the truth was still seeping through the cracks. Her reality has always been carefully stitched together, balanced on a tightrope only via the act of momentum. She believes, somewhere deep down - that this is a lie. But she's grateful anyway. Tima returns her coworker's hug, and sniffles a bit even as she laughs. She doesn't ask about his injury, about the house, the chief, the symbols. (Coward. She feels her own thoughts twist against her. A crack in the pavement.) "...Lets go home." Somewhere warmer, hopefully. @ksh's darling pookie sweetums

ksh's darling pookie sweetums 05-Nov-22 07:27 PM
There is no shame in giving in. There is no harm in knowing what you want and letting yourself sink deeper, among the flowers. Mint hugs you and he's real, he feels so real. The flowers feel real too, even though you know that there's nothing that you have that can ever bring life back to death. You've tipped over to a side, living or dead, a choice has been made for you. That inscription burns so deep inside your head it melts through you, and you feel like if you lean away from your coworker you'll find him splattered with the bits of you, trying desperately to keep everything from leaking out. But — but! Good news. y̶͗͠ȯ̷̧ư̸̅ ̷̑̐m̵̿̋a̶̿͘d̸͑̃e̶̒͝ ̷̛̆i̶͇̇t̷̛̿.̷̜̄ You really did ̸̲̆m̶̒̀a̴̙̕k̵̈́̀e̶̜̚ ̴̗͂ì̶̗t̴̽̃.̴̹̄ Even if ̷͂̕ẙ̷͈ő̶̈́ụ̸̅r̸̆̔ ̷̟̐l̸̝̓i̵̇͊f̶͎́é̸͜ ̶̝̅g̴̈́̊i̵̽̍v̷̇̍e̸̦̽s̵̙͐ ̶̉͒o̶͈͋u̶̿̄t̸͗͝ — what else did you have to lose? Fatima Almeida was already dead, and it was too much of a bother to try undoing that mistake error truth. Mint pulls back, and he's grinning. His eye looks a little sore, but he's happy, even if you feel like you're being cut open on an operating table and having your guts emptied. You've watched a few dissection videos to know that it'll be your heart that goes first. "Okay, let's go home. Where we're safe." [NO HONOR IN SACRIFICE] ;And when you choose to never sacrifice at all, is that cowardice or just being smart?
FINISHED! THANK U, TOMORROW WILL BE THE ENDING @scarecROY 💜👻 tima
